                                 </div>
                                 <p class="description">Indicates the value of the attribute, characteristic, or quality.</p>
                                 
                                 --&gt;      
                                 
                                 --&gt;      </div>
                           </section>
                           <section class="xml-element">
                              <div class="header">
                                 <div class="crosslink"><a href="../json-reference/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observations/origins/related-tasks/identified-subject/subjects/include-subjects/props/class"><button class="schema-link">Switch to JSON</button></a></div>
                                 <h9 id="/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observation/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/include-subject/prop/@class" class="toc9 head">@class</h9>
                              </div>
                              <p>See <a href="../xml-outline/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observation/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/include-subject/prop/@class">/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observation/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/include-subject/prop/@class</a> in the element map.</p>
                              <div class="obj-desc">
                                 <div class="obj-matrix">
                                    <p class="obj-name">attribute Property Class</p>
                                    <p class="occurrence"><span class="cardinality">[0 or 1]</span></p>
                                    <p>An attribute of type <a href="link.to.NCName">NCName</a></p>
                                 </div>
                                 <p class="description">A textual label that provides a sub-type or characterization of the property's <code>name</code>. This can be used to further distinguish or discriminate between the semantics of
                                    multiple properties of the same object with the same <code>name</code> and <code>ns</code>. </p>
                                 
                                 --&gt;      
                                 
                                 --&gt;      
                                 <details open="open" class="remarks-group">
                                    <summary>Remarks</summary>
                                    <div class="remarks">
                                       <p>A <code>class</code> can be used in validation rules to express extra constraints over named items of
                                          a specific <code>class</code> value.</p>
                                    </div>
                                 </details>
                              </div>
                           </section>
                           <section class="xml-element">
                              <div class="header">
                                 <div class="crosslink"><a href="../json-reference/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observations/origins/related-tasks/identified-subject/subjects/include-subjects/props/remarks"><button class="schema-link">Switch to JSON</button></a></div>
                                 <h9 id="/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observation/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/include-subject/prop/remarks" class="toc9 head">remarks</h9>
                              </div>
                              <p>See <a href="../xml-outline/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observation/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/include-subject/prop/remarks">/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observation/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/include-subject/prop/remarks</a> in the element map.</p>
                              <div class="obj-desc">
                                 <div class="obj-matrix">
                                    <p class="obj-name">element Remarks</p>
                                    <p class="occurrence"><span class="cardinality">[0 or 1]</span></p>
                                    <p>An element of type <a href="link.to.markup-multiline">markup-multiline</a></p>
                                 </div>

                                 </div>

                        </section>
                        <section class="xml-element">
                           <div class="header">
                              <div class="crosslink"><a href="../json-reference/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observations/origins/related-tasks/identified-subject/subjects/include-subjects/links"><button class="schema-link">Switch to JSON</button></a></div>
                              <h8 id="/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observation/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/include-subject/link" class="toc8 head">link</h8>
                           </div>
                           <p>See <a href="../xml-outline/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observation/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/include-subject/link">/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observation/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/include-subject/link</a> in the element map.</p>
                           <div class="obj-desc">
                              <div class="obj-matrix">
                                 <p class="obj-name">element Link</p>
                                 <p class="occurrence"><span class="cardinality">[0 to ∞]</span></p>
                                 <p>An element </p>
                              </div>
                              <p class="description">A reference to a local or remote resource</p>
                              
                              --&gt;      
                              
                              --&gt;      
                              
                              --&gt;      
                              <details open="open" class="remarks-group">
                                 <summary>Remarks</summary>
                                 <div class="remarks">
                                    <p>To provide a cryptographic hash for a remote target resource, a local reference to
                                       a back matter <code>resource</code> is needed. The resource allows one or more hash values to be provided using the <code>rlink/hash</code> object.</p>
                                    <p>The OSCAL <code>link</code> is a roughly based on the HTML <a>link element</a>. </p>
                                 </div>
                              </details>
                           </div>
                           <section class="xml-element">
                              <div class="header">
                                 <div class="crosslink"><a href="../json-reference/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observations/origins/related-tasks/identified-subject/subjects/include-subjects/links/href"><button class="schema-link">Switch to JSON</button></a></div>
                                 <h9 id="/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observation/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/include-subject/link/@href" class="toc9 head">@href</h9>
                              </div>
                              <p>See <a href="../xml-outline/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observation/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/include-subject/link/@href">/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observation/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/include-subject/link/@href</a> in the element map.</p>
                              <div class="obj-desc">
                                 <div class="obj-matrix">
                                    <p class="obj-name">attribute Hypertext Reference</p>
                                    <p class="occurrence"><span class="cardinality">[1]</span></p>
                                    <p>An attribute of type <a href="link.to.uri-reference">uri-reference</a></p>
                                 </div>
                                 <p class="description">A resolvable URL reference to a resource.</p>
                                 
                                 --&gt;      
                                 
                                 --&gt;      
                                 
                                 --&gt;      
                                 <details open="open" class="remarks-group">
                                    <summary>Remarks</summary>
                                    <div class="remarks">
                                       <p>The value of the <code>href</code> can be an internet resource, or a local reference using a fragment e.g. #fragment
                                          that points to a <code>back-matter</code> <code>resource</code> in the same document.</p>
                                       <p>If a local reference using a fragment is used, this will be indicated by a fragment
                                          "#" followed by an identifier which references an identified <code>resource</code> in the document's <code>back-matter</code> or another object that is within the scope of the containing OSCAL document.</p>
                                       <p>If an internet resource is used, the <code>href</code> value will be an absolute or relative URI pointing to the location of the referenced
                                          resource. A relative URI will be resolved relative to the location of the document
                                          containing the link.</p>
                                    </div>
                                 </details>
                              </div>
                           </section>
                           <section class="xml-element">
                              <div class="header">
                                 <div class="crosslink"><a href="../json-reference/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observations/origins/related-tasks/identified-subject/subjects/include-subjects/links/rel"><button class="schema-link">Switch to JSON</button></a></div>

                              </div>
                              <p>See <a href="../xml-outline/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observation/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/include-subject/link/@rel">/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observation/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/include-subject/link/@rel</a> in the element map.</p>
                              <div class="obj-desc">
                                 <div class="obj-matrix">
                                    <p class="obj-name">attribute Relation</p>
                                    <p class="occurrence"><span class="cardinality">[0 or 1]</span></p>
                                    <p>An attribute of type <a href="link.to.NCName">NCName</a></p>
                                 </div>
                                 <p class="description">Describes the type of relationship provided by the link. This can be an indicator
                                    of the link's purpose.</p>
                                 
                                 --&gt;

                           </section>

                        <section class="xml-element">
                           <div class="header">
                              <div class="crosslink"><a href="../json-reference/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observations/origins/related-tasks/identified-subject/subjects/exclude-subjects/props"><button class="schema-link">Switch to JSON</button></a></div>
                              <h8 id="/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observation/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/exclude-subject/prop" class="toc8 head">prop</h8>
                           </div>
                           <p>See <a href="../xml-outline/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observation/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/exclude-subject/prop">/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observation/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/exclude-subject/prop</a> in the element map.</p>
                           <div class="obj-desc">
                              <div class="obj-matrix">
                                 <p class="obj-name">element Property</p>
                                 <p class="occurrence"><span class="cardinality">[0 to ∞]</span></p>
                                 <p>An element </p>
                              </div>
                              <p class="description">An attribute, characteristic, or quality of the containing object expressed as a namespace
                                 qualified name/value pair. The value of a property is a simple scalar value, which
                                 may be expressed as a list of values.</p>
                              
                              --&gt;      
                              
                              --&gt;      
                              <details open="open" class="remarks-group">
                                 <summary>Remarks</summary>
                                 <div class="remarks">
                                    <p>Properties permit the deployment and management of arbitrary controlled values, within
                                       OSCAL objects. A property can be included for any purpose useful to an application
                                       or implementation. Typically, properties will be used to sort, filter, select, order,
                                       and arrange OSCAL content objects, to relate OSCAL objects to one another, or to associate
                                       an OSCAL object to class hierarchies, taxonomies, or external authorities. Thus, the
                                       lexical composition of properties may be constrained by external processes to ensure
                                       consistency.</p>
                                    <p>Property allows for associated remarks that describe why the specific property value
                                       was applied to the containing object, or the significance of the value in the context
                                       of the containing object.</p>
                                 </div>
                              </details>
                           </div>
                           <section class="xml-element">
                              <div class="header">
                                 <div class="crosslink"><a href="../json-reference/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observations/origins/related-tasks/identified-subject/subjects/exclude-subjects/props/name"><button class="schema-link">Switch to JSON</button></a></div>
                                 <h9 id="/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observation/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/exclude-subject/prop/@name" class="toc9 head">@name</h9>
                              </div>
                              <p>See <a href="../xml-outline/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observation/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/exclude-subject/prop/@name">/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observation/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/exclude-subject/prop/@name</a> in the element map.</p>
                              <div class="obj-desc">
                                 <div class="obj-matrix">
                                    <p class="obj-name">attribute Property Name</p>
                                    <p class="occurrence"><span class="cardinality">[1]</span></p>
                                    <p>An attribute of type <a href="link.to.NCName">NCName</a></p>
                                 </div>
                                 <p class="description">A textual label that uniquely identifies a specific attribute, characteristic, or
                                    quality of the property's containing object.</p>
                                 
                                 --&gt;      
                                 
                                 --&gt;      
                                 
                                 --&gt;      </div>
                           </section>
                           <section class="xml-element">
                              <div class="header">
                                 <div class="crosslink"><a href="../json-reference/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observations/origins/related-tasks/identified-subject/subjects/exclude-subjects/props/uuid"><button class="schema-link">Switch to JSON</button></a></div>
                                 <h9 id="/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observation/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/exclude-subject/prop/@uuid" class="toc9 head">@uuid</h9>
                              </div>
                              <p>See <a href="../xml-outline/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observation/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/exclude-subject/prop/@uuid">/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observation/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/exclude-subject/prop/@uuid</a> in the element map.</p>
                              <div class="obj-desc">
                                 <div class="obj-matrix">
                                    <p class="obj-name">attribute Property Universally Unique Identifier</p>
                                    <p class="occurrence"><span class="cardinality">[0 or 1]</span></p>
                                    <p>An attribute of type <a href="link.to.uuid">uuid</a></p>
                                 </div>
                                 <p class="description">A unique identifier that can be used to reference this property elsewhere in an OSCAL
                                    document. A UUID should be consistently used for a given location across revisions
                                    of the document.</p>
                                 
                                 --&gt;      
                                 
                                 --&gt;      </div>
                           </section>
                           <section class="xml-element">
                              <div class="header">
                                 <div class="crosslink"><a href="../json-reference/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observations/origins/related-tasks/identified-subject/subjects/exclude-subjects/props/ns"><button class="schema-link">Switch to JSON</button></a></div>
                                 <h9 id="/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observation/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/exclude-subject/prop/@ns" class="toc9 head">@ns</h9>
                              </div>
                              <p>See <a href="../xml-outline/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observation/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/exclude-subject/prop/@ns">/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observation/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/exclude-subject/prop/@ns</a> in the element map.</p>
                              <div class="obj-desc">
                                 <div class="obj-matrix">
                                    <p class="obj-name">attribute Property Namespace</p>
                                    <p class="occurrence"><span class="cardinality">[0 or 1]</span></p>
                                    <p>An attribute of type <a href="link.to.uri">uri</a></p>
                                 </div>
                                 <p class="description">A namespace qualifying the property's name. This allows different organizations to
                                    associate distinct semantics with the same name.</p>
                                 
                                 --&gt;      
                                 
                                 --&gt;      
                                 <details open="open" class="remarks-group">
                                    <summary>Remarks</summary>
                                    <div class="remarks">
                                       <p>Provides a means to segment the value space for the <code>name</code>, so that different organizations and individuals can assert control over the allowed
                                          names and associated values used in a property. This allows the semantics associated
                                          with a given name/value pair to be defined on an organization-by-organization basis.</p>
                                       <p>An organization MUST use a URI that they have control over. e.g., a domain registered
                                          to the organization in a URI, a registered uniform resource names (URN) namespace.</p>
                                       <p>When a <code>ns</code> is not provided, its value should be assumed to be <code>http://csrc.nist.gov/ns/oscal</code> and the name should be a name defined by the associated OSCAL model.</p>
                                    </div>
                                 </details>
                              </div>
                           </section>
                           <section class="xml-element">
                              <div class="header">
                                 <div class="crosslink"><a href="../json-reference/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observations/origins/related-tasks/identified-subject/subjects/exclude-subjects/props/value"><button class="schema-link">Switch to JSON</button></a></div>
                                 <h9 id="/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observation/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/exclude-subject/prop/@value" class="toc9 head">@value</h9>
                              </div>
                              <p>See <a href="../xml-outline/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observation/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/exclude-subject/prop/@value">/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observation/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/exclude-subject/prop/@value</a> in the element map.</p>
                              <div class="obj-desc">

                                    <p>An attribute of type <a href="link.to.string">string</a></p>
                                 </div>
                                 <p class="description">Indicates the value of the attribute, characteristic, or quality.</p>
                                 
                                 --&gt;      
                                 
                                 --&gt;      </div>
                           </section>
                           <section class="xml-element">
                              <div class="header">
                                 <div class="crosslink"><a href="../json-reference/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observations/origins/related-tasks/identified-subject/subjects/exclude-subjects/props/class"><button class="schema-link">Switch to JSON</button></a></div>
                                 <h9 id="/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observation/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/exclude-subject/prop/@class" class="toc9 head">@class</h9>
                              </div>
                              <p>See <a href="../xml-outline/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observation/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/exclude-subject/prop/@class">/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observation/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/exclude-subject/prop/@class</a> in the element map.</p>
                              <div class="obj-desc">
                                 <div class="obj-matrix">
                                    <p class="obj-name">attribute Property Class</p>
                                    <p class="occurrence"><span class="cardinality">[0 or 1]</span></p>
                                    <p>An attribute of type <a href="link.to.NCName">NCName</a></p>
                                 </div>
                                 <p class="description">A textual label that provides a sub-type or characterization of the property's <code>name</code>. This can be used to further distinguish or discriminate between the semantics of
                                    multiple properties of the same object with the same <code>name</code> and <code>ns</code>. </p>
                                 
                                 --&gt;      
                                 
                                 --&gt;      
                                 <details open="open" class="remarks-group">
                                    <summary>Remarks</summary>
                                    <div class="remarks">
                                       <p>A <code>class</code> can be used in validation rules to express extra constraints over named items of
                                          a specific <code>class</code> value.</p>
                                    </div>
                                 </details>
                              </div>
                           </section>
                           <section class="xml-element">
                              <div class="header">
                                 <div class="crosslink"><a href="../json-reference/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observations/origins/related-tasks/identified-subject/subjects/exclude-subjects/props/remarks"><button class="schema-link">Switch to JSON</button></a></div>
                                 <h9 id="/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observation/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/exclude-subject/prop/remarks" class="toc9 head">remarks</h9>
                              </div>
                              <p>See <a href="../xml-outline/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observation/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/exclude-subject/prop/remarks">/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observation/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/exclude-subject/prop/remarks</a> in the element map.</p>
                              <div class="obj-desc">
                                 <div class="obj-matrix">
                                    <p class="obj-name">element Remarks</p>
                                    <p class="occurrence"><span class="cardinality">[0 or 1]</span></p>
                                    <p>An element of type <a href="link.to.markup-multiline">markup-multiline</a></p>
                                 </div>
                                 <p class="description">Additional commentary on the containing object.</p>
                                 <div class="value" id="">

                                 </div>
                                 
                                 --&gt;

                        </section>
                        <section class="xml-element">
                           <div class="header">
                              <div class="crosslink"><a href="../json-reference/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observations/origins/related-tasks/identified-subject/subjects/exclude-subjects/links"><button class="schema-link">Switch to JSON</button></a></div>
                              <h8 id="/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observation/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/exclude-subject/link" class="toc8 head">link</h8>
                           </div>
                           <p>See <a href="../xml-outline/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observation/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/exclude-subject/link">/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observation/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/exclude-subject/link</a> in the element map.</p>
                           <div class="obj-desc">
                              <div class="obj-matrix">
                                 <p class="obj-name">element Link</p>
                                 <p class="occurrence"><span class="cardinality">[0 to ∞]</span></p>
                                 <p>An element </p>
                              </div>
                              <p class="description">A reference to a local or remote resource</p>
                              
                              --&gt;      
                              
                              --&gt;      
                              
                              --&gt;      
                              <details open="open" class="remarks-group">
                                 <summary>Remarks</summary>
                                 <div class="remarks">
                                    <p>To provide a cryptographic hash for a remote target resource, a local reference to
                                       a back matter <code>resource</code> is needed. The resource allows one or more hash values to be provided using the <code>rlink/hash</code> object.</p>
                                    <p>The OSCAL <code>link</code> is a roughly based on the HTML <a>link element</a>. </p>
                                 </div>
                              </details>
                           </div>
                           <section class="xml-element">
                              <div class="header">
                                 <div class="crosslink"><a href="../json-reference/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observations/origins/related-tasks/identified-subject/subjects/exclude-subjects/links/href"><button class="schema-link">Switch to JSON</button></a></div>
                                 <h9 id="/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observation/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/exclude-subject/link/@href" class="toc9 head">@href</h9>
                              </div>
                              <p>See <a href="../xml-outline/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observation/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/exclude-subject/link/@href">/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observation/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/exclude-subject/link/@href</a> in the element map.</p>
                              <div class="obj-desc">
                                 <div class="obj-matrix">
                                    <p class="obj-name">attribute Hypertext Reference</p>
                                    <p class="occurrence"><span class="cardinality">[1]</span></p>
                                    <p>An attribute of type <a href="link.to.uri-reference">uri-reference</a></p>
                                 </div>
                                 <p class="description">A resolvable URL reference to a resource.</p>
                                 
                                 --&gt;      
                                 
                                 --&gt;      
                                 
                                 --&gt;      
                                 <details open="open" class="remarks-group">
                                    <summary>Remarks</summary>
                                    <div class="remarks">
                                       <p>The value of the <code>href</code> can be an internet resource, or a local reference using a fragment e.g. #fragment
                                          that points to a <code>back-matter</code> <code>resource</code> in the same document.</p>
                                       <p>If a local reference using a fragment is used, this will be indicated by a fragment
                                          "#" followed by an identifier which references an identified <code>resource</code> in the document's <code>back-matter</code> or another object that is within the scope of the containing OSCAL document.</p>
                                       <p>If an internet resource is used, the <code>href</code> value will be an absolute or relative URI pointing to the location of the referenced
                                          resource. A relative URI will be resolved relative to the location of the document
                                          containing the link.</p>
                                    </div>
                                 </details>
                              </div>
                           </section>
                           <section class="xml-element">
                              <div class="header">
                                 <div class="crosslink"><a href="../json-reference/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observations/origins/related-tasks/identified-subject/subjects/exclude-subjects/links/rel"><button class="schema-link">Switch to JSON</button></a></div>

                              </div>
                              <p>See <a href="../xml-outline/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observation/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/exclude-subject/link/@rel">/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observation/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/exclude-subject/link/@rel</a> in the element map.</p>
                              <div class="obj-desc">
                                 <div class="obj-matrix">
                                    <p class="obj-name">attribute Relation</p>
                                    <p class="occurrence"><span class="cardinality">[0 or 1]</span></p>
                                    <p>An attribute of type <a href="link.to.NCName">NCName</a></p>
                                 </div>
                                 <p class="description">Describes the type of relationship provided by the link. This can be an indicator
                                    of the link's purpose.</p>
                                 
                                 --&gt;

                                 --&gt;      
                                 
                                 --&gt;      </div>
                           </section>

         <section class="xml-element">
            <div class="header">
               <div class="crosslink"><a href="../json-reference/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observations/subjects"><button class="schema-link">Switch to JSON</button></a></div>
               <h3 id="/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observation/subject" class="toc3 head">subject</h3>
            </div>
            <p>See <a href="../xml-outline/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observation/subject">/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observation/subject</a> in the element map.</p>
            <div class="obj-desc">
               <div class="obj-matrix">
                  <p class="obj-name">element Identifies the Subject</p>
                  <p class="occurrence"><span class="cardinality">[0 to ∞]</span></p>
                  <p>An element </p>
               </div>
               <p class="description">A pointer to a resource based on its universally unique identifier (UUID). Use type
                  to indicate whether the identified resource is a component, inventory item, location,
                  user, or something else.</p>
               
               --&gt;      
               <details open="open" class="remarks-group">
                  <summary>Remarks</summary>
                  <div class="remarks in-use">
                     <p class="nb">(In use)</p>
                     <p>Identifies who was interviewed, or what was tested or inspected.</p>
                  </div>
                  <div class="remarks">
                     <p>The subject reference UUID could point to an item defined in the SSP, AP, or AR.</p>
                     <p>Tools should check look for the ID in every file imported directly or indirectly.</p>
                  </div>
               </details>
            </div>
            <section class="xml-element">
               <div class="header">
                  <div class="crosslink"><a href="../json-reference/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observations/subjects/subject-uuid"><button class="schema-link">Switch to JSON</button></a></div>

               </div>
               <p>See <a href="../xml-outline/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observation/subject/@subject-uuid">/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observation/subject/@subject-uuid</a> in the element map.</p>

                  <div class="obj-matrix">
                     <p class="obj-name">attribute Subject Universally Unique Identifier Reference</p>
                     <p class="occurrence"><span class="cardinality">[1]</span></p>
                     <p>An attribute of type <a href="link.to.uuid">uuid</a></p>
                  </div>
                  <p class="description">A pointer to a component, inventory-item, location, party, user, or resource using
                     it's UUID.</p>
                  
                  --&gt;      </div>
            </section>
            <section class="xml-element">
               <div class="header">

               </div>

               <div class="obj-desc">

                     <p>An attribute of type <a href="link.to.NCName">NCName</a></p>
                  </div>
                  <p class="description">Used to indicate the type of object pointed to by the <code>uuid-ref</code> within a subject.</p>
                  
                  --&gt;      
                  
                  --&gt;      </div>
            </section>
            <section class="xml-element">
               <div class="header">
                  <div class="crosslink"><a href="../json-reference/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observations/subjects/title"><button class="schema-link">Switch to JSON</button></a></div>

               </div>
               <p>See <a href="../xml-outline/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observation/subject/title">/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observation/subject/title</a> in the element map.</p>
               <div class="obj-desc">

                     <p>Value: A markup-line </p>
                  </div>
                  
                  --&gt;      </div>
            </section>
            <section class="xml-element">
               <div class="header">
                  <div class="crosslink"><a href="../json-reference/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observations/subjects/props"><button class="schema-link">Switch to JSON</button></a></div>
                  <h4 id="/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observation/subject/prop" class="toc4 head">prop</h4>
               </div>
               <p>See <a href="../xml-outline/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observation/subject/prop">/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observation/subject/prop</a> in the element map.</p>
               <div class="obj-desc">
                  <div class="obj-matrix">
                     <p class="obj-name">element Property</p>
                     <p class="occurrence"><span class="cardinality">[0 to ∞]</span></p>
                     <p>An element </p>
                  </div>
                  <p class="description">An attribute, characteristic, or quality of the containing object expressed as a namespace
                     qualified name/value pair. The value of a property is a simple scalar value, which
                     may be expressed as a list of values.</p>
                  
                  --&gt;      
                  <details open="open" class="remarks-group">
                     <summary>Remarks</summary>
                     <div class="remarks">
                        <p>Properties permit the deployment and management of arbitrary controlled values, within
                           OSCAL objects. A property can be included for any purpose useful to an application
                           or implementation. Typically, properties will be used to sort, filter, select, order,
                           and arrange OSCAL content objects, to relate OSCAL objects to one another, or to associate
                           an OSCAL object to class hierarchies, taxonomies, or external authorities. Thus, the
                           lexical composition of properties may be constrained by external processes to ensure
                           consistency.</p>
                        <p>Property allows for associated remarks that describe why the specific property value
                           was applied to the containing object, or the significance of the value in the context
                           of the containing object.</p>
                     </div>
                  </details>
               </div>
               <section class="xml-element">
                  <div class="header">
                     <div class="crosslink"><a href="../json-reference/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observations/subjects/props/name"><button class="schema-link">Switch to JSON</button></a></div>
                     <h5 id="/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observation/subject/prop/@name" class="toc5 head">@name</h5>
                  </div>
                  <p>See <a href="../xml-outline/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observation/subject/prop/@name">/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observation/subject/prop/@name</a> in the element map.</p>
                  <div class="obj-desc">
                     <div class="obj-matrix">
                        <p class="obj-name">attribute Property Name</p>
                        <p class="occurrence"><span class="cardinality">[1]</span></p>
                        <p>An attribute of type <a href="link.to.NCName">NCName</a></p>
                     </div>
                     <p class="description">A textual label that uniquely identifies a specific attribute, characteristic, or
                        quality of the property's containing object.</p>
                     
                     --&gt;      
                     
                     --&gt;      </div>
               </section>
               <section class="xml-element">
                  <div class="header">
                     <div class="crosslink"><a href="../json-reference/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observations/subjects/props/uuid"><button class="schema-link">Switch to JSON</button></a></div>
                     <h5 id="/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observation/subject/prop/@uuid" class="toc5 head">@uuid</h5>
                  </div>
                  <p>See <a href="../xml-outline/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observation/subject/prop/@uuid">/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observation/subject/prop/@uuid</a> in the element map.</p>
                  <div class="obj-desc">
                     <div class="obj-matrix">
                        <p class="obj-name">attribute Property Universally Unique Identifier</p>
                        <p class="occurrence"><span class="cardinality">[0 or 1]</span></p>
                        <p>An attribute of type <a href="link.to.uuid">uuid</a></p>
                     </div>
                     <p class="description">A unique identifier that can be used to reference this property elsewhere in an OSCAL
                        document. A UUID should be consistently used for a given location across revisions
                        of the document.</p>
                     
                     --&gt;      </div>
               </section>
               <section class="xml-element">
                  <div class="header">
                     <div class="crosslink"><a href="../json-reference/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observations/subjects/props/ns"><button class="schema-link">Switch to JSON</button></a></div>
                     <h5 id="/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observation/subject/prop/@ns" class="toc5 head">@ns</h5>
                  </div>
                  <p>See <a href="../xml-outline/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observation/subject/prop/@ns">/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observation/subject/prop/@ns</a> in the element map.</p>
                  <div class="obj-desc">
                     <div class="obj-matrix">
                        <p class="obj-name">attribute Property Namespace</p>
                        <p class="occurrence"><span class="cardinality">[0 or 1]</span></p>
                        <p>An attribute of type <a href="link.to.uri">uri</a></p>
                     </div>
                     <p class="description">A namespace qualifying the property's name. This allows different organizations to
                        associate distinct semantics with the same name.</p>
                     
                     --&gt;      
                     <details open="open" class="remarks-group">
                        <summary>Remarks</summary>
                        <div class="remarks">
                           <p>Provides a means to segment the value space for the <code>name</code>, so that different organizations and individuals can assert control over the allowed
                              names and associated values used in a property. This allows the semantics associated
                              with a given name/value pair to be defined on an organization-by-organization basis.</p>
                           <p>An organization MUST use a URI that they have control over. e.g., a domain registered
                              to the organization in a URI, a registered uniform resource names (URN) namespace.</p>
                           <p>When a <code>ns</code> is not provided, its value should be assumed to be <code>http://csrc.nist.gov/ns/oscal</code> and the name should be a name defined by the associated OSCAL model.</p>
                        </div>
                     </details>
                  </div>
               </section>
               <section class="xml-element">
                  <div class="header">
                     <div class="crosslink"><a href="../json-reference/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observations/subjects/props/value"><button class="schema-link">Switch to JSON</button></a></div>
                     <h5 id="/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observation/subject/prop/@value" class="toc5 head">@value</h5>
                  </div>
                  <p>See <a href="../xml-outline/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observation/subject/prop/@value">/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observation/subject/prop/@value</a> in the element map.</p>
                  <div class="obj-desc">
                     <div class="obj-matrix">
                        <p class="obj-name">attribute Property Value</p>
                        <p class="occurrence"><span class="cardinality">[1]</span></p>
                        <p>An attribute of type <a href="link.to.string">string</a></p>
                     </div>
                     <p class="description">Indicates the value of the attribute, characteristic, or quality.</p>
                     
                     --&gt;      </div>
               </section>
               <section class="xml-element">
                  <div class="header">
                     <div class="crosslink"><a href="../json-reference/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observations/subjects/props/class"><button class="schema-link">Switch to JSON</button></a></div>
                     <h5 id="/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observation/subject/prop/@class" class="toc5 head">@class</h5>
                  </div>
                  <p>See <a href="../xml-outline/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observation/subject/prop/@class">/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observation/subject/prop/@class</a> in the element map.</p>
                  <div class="obj-desc">
                     <div class="obj-matrix">
                        <p class="obj-name">attribute Property Class</p>
                        <p class="occurrence"><span class="cardinality">[0 or 1]</span></p>
                        <p>An attribute of type <a href="link.to.NCName">NCName</a></p>
                     </div>
                     <p class="description">A textual label that provides a sub-type or characterization of the property's <code>name</code>. This can be used to further distinguish or discriminate between the semantics of
                        multiple properties of the same object with the same <code>name</code> and <code>ns</code>. </p>
                     
                     --&gt;      
                     <details open="open" class="remarks-group">
                        <summary>Remarks</summary>
                        <div class="remarks">
                           <p>A <code>class</code> can be used in validation rules to express extra constraints over named items of
                              a specific <code>class</code> value.</p>
                        </div>
                     </details>
                  </div>
               </section>
               <section class="xml-element">
                  <div class="header">

                     <h5 id="/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observation/subject/prop/remarks" class="toc5 head">remarks</h5>
                  </div>
                  <p>See <a href="../xml-outline/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observation/subject/prop/remarks">/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observation/subject/prop/remarks</a> in the element map.</p>
                  <div class="obj-desc">
                     <div class="obj-matrix">
                        <p class="obj-name">element Remarks</p>
                        <p class="occurrence"><span class="cardinality">[0 or 1]</span></p>
                        <p>An element of type <a href="link.to.markup-multiline">markup-multiline</a></p>
                     </div>
                     <p class="description">Additional commentary on the containing object.</p>
                     <div class="value" id="">
                        <p>Value: A markup-multiline </p>
                     </div>
                     
                     --&gt;      </div>
               </section>
            </section>
            <section class="xml-element">
               <div class="header">
                  <div class="crosslink"><a href="../json-reference/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observations/subjects/links"><button class="schema-link">Switch to JSON</button></a></div>
                  <h4 id="/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observation/subject/link" class="toc4 head">link</h4>
               </div>
               <p>See <a href="../xml-outline/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observation/subject/link">/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observation/subject/link</a> in the element map.</p>
               <div class="obj-desc">
                  <div class="obj-matrix">
                     <p class="obj-name">element Link</p>
                     <p class="occurrence"><span class="cardinality">[0 to ∞]</span></p>
                     <p>An element </p>
                  </div>
                  <p class="description">A reference to a local or remote resource</p>
                  
                  --&gt;      
                  
                  --&gt;      
                  <details open="open" class="remarks-group">
                     <summary>Remarks</summary>
                     <div class="remarks">
                        <p>To provide a cryptographic hash for a remote target resource, a local reference to
                           a back matter <code>resource</code> is needed. The resource allows one or more hash values to be provided using the <code>rlink/hash</code> object.</p>
                        <p>The OSCAL <code>link</code> is a roughly based on the HTML <a>link element</a>. </p>
                     </div>
                  </details>
               </div>
               <section class="xml-element">
                  <div class="header">
                     <div class="crosslink"><a href="../json-reference/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observations/subjects/links/href"><button class="schema-link">Switch to JSON</button></a></div>
                     <h5 id="/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observation/subject/link/@href" class="toc5 head">@href</h5>
                  </div>
                  <p>See <a href="../xml-outline/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observation/subject/link/@href">/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observation/subject/link/@href</a> in the element map.</p>
                  <div class="obj-desc">
                     <div class="obj-matrix">
                        <p class="obj-name">attribute Hypertext Reference</p>
                        <p class="occurrence"><span class="cardinality">[1]</span></p>
                        <p>An attribute of type <a href="link.to.uri-reference">uri-reference</a></p>
                     </div>
                     <p class="description">A resolvable URL reference to a resource.</p>
                     
                     --&gt;      
                     
                     --&gt;      
                     <details open="open" class="remarks-group">
                        <summary>Remarks</summary>
                        <div class="remarks">
                           <p>The value of the <code>href</code> can be an internet resource, or a local reference using a fragment e.g. #fragment
                              that points to a <code>back-matter</code> <code>resource</code> in the same document.</p>
                           <p>If a local reference using a fragment is used, this will be indicated by a fragment
                              "#" followed by an identifier which references an identified <code>resource</code> in the document's <code>back-matter</code> or another object that is within the scope of the containing OSCAL document.</p>
                           <p>If an internet resource is used, the <code>href</code> value will be an absolute or relative URI pointing to the location of the referenced
                              resource. A relative URI will be resolved relative to the location of the document
                              containing the link.</p>
                        </div>
                     </details>
                  </div>
               </section>
               <section class="xml-element">
                  <div class="header">
                     <div class="crosslink"><a href="../json-reference/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observations/subjects/links/rel"><button class="schema-link">Switch to JSON</button></a></div>

                  <div class="obj-desc">
                     <div class="obj-matrix">
                        <p class="obj-name">attribute Relation</p>
                        <p class="occurrence"><span class="cardinality">[0 or 1]</span></p>
                        <p>An attribute of type <a href="link.to.NCName">NCName</a></p>
                     </div>
                     <p class="description">Describes the type of relationship provided by the link. This can be an indicator
                        of the link's purpose.</p>
                     
                     --&gt;      
                     
                     --&gt;      
                     
                     --&gt;      </div>
               </section>

               </div>

               --&gt;      </div>
            <section class="xml-element">
               <div class="header">
                  <div class="crosslink"><a href="../json-reference/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observations/relevant-evidence/href"><button class="schema-link">Switch to JSON</button></a></div>

               </div>
               <p>See <a href="../xml-outline/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observation/relevant-evidence/@href">/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observation/relevant-evidence/@href</a> in the element map.</p>
               <div class="obj-desc">
                  <div class="obj-matrix">
                     <p class="obj-name">attribute Relevant Evidence Reference</p>
                     <p class="occurrence"><span class="cardinality">[0 or 1]</span></p>
                     <p>An attribute of type <a href="link.to.uri-reference">uri-reference</a></p>
                  </div>
                  <p class="description">&gt;A resolvable URL reference to relevant evidence.</p>
                  
                  --&gt;      
                  <details open="open" class="remarks-group">
                     <summary>Remarks</summary>
                     <div class="remarks">
                        <p>The value of the <code>href</code> can be an internet resource, or a local reference using a fragment e.g. #fragment
                           that points to a <code>back-matter</code> <code>resource</code> in the same document.</p>
                        <p>If a local reference using a fragment is used, this will be indicated by a fragment
                           "#" followed by an identifier which references an identified <code>resource</code> in the document's <code>back-matter</code> or another object that is <a>within the scope of the containing OSCAL document</a>.</p>
                        <p>If an internet resource is used, the <code>href</code> value will be an absolute or relative URI pointing to the location of the referenced
                           resource. A relative URI will be resolved relative to the location of the document
                           containing the link.</p>
                     </div>
                  </details>
               </div>
            </section>
            <section class="xml-element">
               <div class="header">

               </div>

            <section class="xml-element">
               <div class="header">

                  <h4 id="/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observation/relevant-evidence/prop" class="toc4 head">prop</h4>
               </div>
               <p>See <a href="../xml-outline/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observation/relevant-evidence/prop">/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observation/relevant-evidence/prop</a> in the element map.</p>
               <div class="obj-desc">
                  <div class="obj-matrix">
                     <p class="obj-name">element Property</p>
                     <p class="occurrence"><span class="cardinality">[0 to ∞]</span></p>
                     <p>An element </p>
                  </div>
                  <p class="description">An attribute, characteristic, or quality of the containing object expressed as a namespace
                     qualified name/value pair. The value of a property is a simple scalar value, which
                     may be expressed as a list of values.</p>
                  
                  --&gt;      
                  <details open="open" class="remarks-group">
                     <summary>Remarks</summary>
                     <div class="remarks">
                        <p>Properties permit the deployment and management of arbitrary controlled values, within
                           OSCAL objects. A property can be included for any purpose useful to an application
                           or implementation. Typically, properties will be used to sort, filter, select, order,
                           and arrange OSCAL content objects, to relate OSCAL objects to one another, or to associate
                           an OSCAL object to class hierarchies, taxonomies, or external authorities. Thus, the
                           lexical composition of properties may be constrained by external processes to ensure
                           consistency.</p>
                        <p>Property allows for associated remarks that describe why the specific property value
                           was applied to the containing object, or the significance of the value in the context
                           of the containing object.</p>
                     </div>
                  </details>
               </div>

                  <div class="header">

                  <div class="obj-desc">
                     <div class="obj-matrix">
                        <p class="obj-name">attribute Property Name</p>
                        <p class="occurrence"><span class="cardinality">[1]</span></p>
                        <p>An attribute of type <a href="link.to.NCName">NCName</a></p>
                     </div>
                     <p class="description">A textual label that uniquely identifies a specific attribute, characteristic, or
                        quality of the property's containing object.</p>
                     
                     --&gt;      
                     
                     --&gt;      </div>
               </section>

                        <p>An attribute of type <a href="link.to.uuid">uuid</a></p>
                     </div>
                     <p class="description">A unique identifier that can be used to reference this property elsewhere in an OSCAL
                        document. A UUID should be consistently used for a given location across revisions
                        of the document.</p>
                     
                     --&gt;      </div>
               </section>
               <section class="xml-element">
                  <div class="header">

                     <h5 id="/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observation/relevant-evidence/prop/@ns" class="toc5 head">@ns</h5>
                  </div>
                  <p>See <a href="../xml-outline/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observation/relevant-evidence/prop/@ns">/plan-of-action-and-milestones/observation/relevant-evidence/prop/@ns</a> in the element map.</p>
                  <div class="obj-desc">
                     <div class="obj-matrix">
                        <p class="obj-name">attribute Property Namespace</p>
                        <p class="occurrence"><span class="cardinality">[0 or 1]</span></p>
                        <p>An attribute of type <a href="link.to.uri">uri</a></p>
                     </div>
                     <p class="description">A namespace qualifying the property's name. This allows different organizations to
                        associate distinct semantics with the same name.</p>
                     
                     --&gt;      
                     <details open="open" class="remarks-group">
                        <summary>Remarks</summary>
                        <div class="remarks">
                           <p>Provides a means to segment the value space for the <code>name</code>, so that different organizations and individuals can assert control over the allowed
                              names and associated values used in a property. This allows the semantics associated
                              with a given name/value pair to be defined on an organization-by-organization basis.</p>
                           <p>An organization MUST use a URI that they have control over. e.g., a domain registered
                              to the organization in a URI, a registered uniform resource names (URN) namespace.</p>
                           <p>When a <code>ns</code> is not provided, its value should be assumed to be <code>http://csrc.nist.gov/ns/oscal</code> and the name should be a name defined by the associated OSCAL model.</p>
                        </div>
                     </details>
                  </div>
               </section>

                     --&gt;      </div>
               </section>

                     <p class="description">A textual label that provides a sub-type or characterization of the property's <code>name</code>. This can be used to further distinguish or discriminate between the semantics of
                        multiple properties of the same object with the same <code>name</code> and <code>ns</code>. </p>

                  --&gt;

                     <div class="remarks">
                        <p>To provide a cryptographic hash for a remote target resource, a local reference to
                           a back matter <code>resource</code> is needed. The resource allows one or more hash values to be provided using the <code>rlink/hash</code> object.</p>
                        <p>The OSCAL <code>link</code> is a roughly based on the HTML <a>link element</a>. </p>

            </div>
            <p>See <a href="../xml-outline/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/prop">/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/prop</a> in the element map.</p>

               <div class="obj-matrix">
                  <p class="obj-name">element Property</p>
                  <p class="occurrence"><span class="cardinality">[0 to ∞]</span></p>
                  <p>An element </p>
               </div>
               <p class="description">An attribute, characteristic, or quality of the containing object expressed as a namespace
                  qualified name/value pair. The value of a property is a simple scalar value, which
                  may be expressed as a list of values.</p>
               
               --&gt;      
               <details open="open" class="remarks-group">
                  <summary>Remarks</summary>
                  <div class="remarks">
                     <p>Properties permit the deployment and management of arbitrary controlled values, within
                        OSCAL objects. A property can be included for any purpose useful to an application
                        or implementation. Typically, properties will be used to sort, filter, select, order,
                        and arrange OSCAL content objects, to relate OSCAL objects to one another, or to associate
                        an OSCAL object to class hierarchies, taxonomies, or external authorities. Thus, the
                        lexical composition of properties may be constrained by external processes to ensure
                        consistency.</p>
                     <p>Property allows for associated remarks that describe why the specific property value
                        was applied to the containing object, or the significance of the value in the context
                        of the containing object.</p>
                  </div>
               </details>
            </div>

                  </div>

            </section>
            <section class="xml-element">
               <div class="header">
                  <div class="crosslink"><a href="../json-reference/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risks/props/ns"><button class="schema-link">Switch to JSON</button></a></div>
                  <h4 id="/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/prop/@ns" class="toc4 head">@ns</h4>
               </div>
               <p>See <a href="../xml-outline/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/prop/@ns">/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/prop/@ns</a> in the element map.</p>
               <div class="obj-desc">
                  <div class="obj-matrix">
                     <p class="obj-name">attribute Property Namespace</p>
                     <p class="occurrence"><span class="cardinality">[0 or 1]</span></p>
                     <p>An attribute of type <a href="link.to.uri">uri</a></p>
                  </div>
                  <p class="description">A namespace qualifying the property's name. This allows different organizations to
                     associate distinct semantics with the same name.</p>
                  
                  --&gt;      
                  <details open="open" class="remarks-group">
                     <summary>Remarks</summary>
                     <div class="remarks">
                        <p>Provides a means to segment the value space for the <code>name</code>, so that different organizations and individuals can assert control over the allowed
                           names and associated values used in a property. This allows the semantics associated
                           with a given name/value pair to be defined on an organization-by-organization basis.</p>
                        <p>An organization MUST use a URI that they have control over. e.g., a domain registered
                           to the organization in a URI, a registered uniform resource names (URN) namespace.</p>
                        <p>When a <code>ns</code> is not provided, its value should be assumed to be <code>http://csrc.nist.gov/ns/oscal</code> and the name should be a name defined by the associated OSCAL model.</p>
                     </div>
                  </details>
               </div>
            </section>
            <section class="xml-element">
               <div class="header">

         <section class="xml-element">
            <div class="header">
               <div class="crosslink"><a href="../json-reference/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risks/links"><button class="schema-link">Switch to JSON</button></a></div>
               <h3 id="/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/link" class="toc3 head">link</h3>
            </div>
            <p>See <a href="../xml-outline/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/link">/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/link</a> in the element map.</p>
            <div class="obj-desc">
               <div class="obj-matrix">
                  <p class="obj-name">element Link</p>
                  <p class="occurrence"><span class="cardinality">[0 to ∞]</span></p>
                  <p>An element </p>
               </div>
               <p class="description">A reference to a local or remote resource</p>
               
               --&gt;      
               
               --&gt;      
               <details open="open" class="remarks-group">
                  <summary>Remarks</summary>
                  <div class="remarks">
                     <p>To provide a cryptographic hash for a remote target resource, a local reference to
                        a back matter <code>resource</code> is needed. The resource allows one or more hash values to be provided using the <code>rlink/hash</code> object.</p>
                     <p>The OSCAL <code>link</code> is a roughly based on the HTML <a>link element</a>. </p>
                  </div>
               </details>
            </div>
            <section class="xml-element">
               <div class="header">
                  <div class="crosslink"><a href="../json-reference/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risks/links/href"><button class="schema-link">Switch to JSON</button></a></div>
                  <h4 id="/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/link/@href" class="toc4 head">@href</h4>
               </div>
               <p>See <a href="../xml-outline/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/link/@href">/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/link/@href</a> in the element map.</p>
               <div class="obj-desc">
                  <div class="obj-matrix">
                     <p class="obj-name">attribute Hypertext Reference</p>
                     <p class="occurrence"><span class="cardinality">[1]</span></p>
                     <p>An attribute of type <a href="link.to.uri-reference">uri-reference</a></p>
                  </div>
                  <p class="description">A resolvable URL reference to a resource.</p>
                  
                  --&gt;      
                  
                  --&gt;      
                  <details open="open" class="remarks-group">
                     <summary>Remarks</summary>
                     <div class="remarks">
                        <p>The value of the <code>href</code> can be an internet resource, or a local reference using a fragment e.g. #fragment
                           that points to a <code>back-matter</code> <code>resource</code> in the same document.</p>
                        <p>If a local reference using a fragment is used, this will be indicated by a fragment
                           "#" followed by an identifier which references an identified <code>resource</code> in the document's <code>back-matter</code> or another object that is within the scope of the containing OSCAL document.</p>
                        <p>If an internet resource is used, the <code>href</code> value will be an absolute or relative URI pointing to the location of the referenced
                           resource. A relative URI will be resolved relative to the location of the document
                           containing the link.</p>
                     </div>
                  </details>
               </div>
            </section>

                     </div>
                     <p class="description">An attribute, characteristic, or quality of the containing object expressed as a namespace

                     <details open="open" class="remarks-group">
                        <summary>Remarks</summary>
                        <div class="remarks">
                           <p>Properties permit the deployment and management of arbitrary controlled values, within
                              OSCAL objects. A property can be included for any purpose useful to an application
                              or implementation. Typically, properties will be used to sort, filter, select, order,
                              and arrange OSCAL content objects, to relate OSCAL objects to one another, or to associate
                              an OSCAL object to class hierarchies, taxonomies, or external authorities. Thus, the
                              lexical composition of properties may be constrained by external processes to ensure
                              consistency.</p>
                           <p>Property allows for associated remarks that describe why the specific property value
                              was applied to the containing object, or the significance of the value in the context
                              of the containing object.</p>
                        </div>
                     </details>

                        <div class="obj-matrix">
                           <p class="obj-name">attribute Property Namespace</p>
                           <p class="occurrence"><span class="cardinality">[0 or 1]</span></p>
                           <p>An attribute of type <a href="link.to.uri">uri</a></p>
                        </div>
                        <p class="description">A namespace qualifying the property's name. This allows different organizations to
                           associate distinct semantics with the same name.</p>
                        
                        --&gt;      
                        <details open="open" class="remarks-group">
                           <summary>Remarks</summary>
                           <div class="remarks">
                              <p>Provides a means to segment the value space for the <code>name</code>, so that different organizations and individuals can assert control over the allowed
                                 names and associated values used in a property. This allows the semantics associated
                                 with a given name/value pair to be defined on an organization-by-organization basis.</p>
                              <p>An organization MUST use a URI that they have control over. e.g., a domain registered
                                 to the organization in a URI, a registered uniform resource names (URN) namespace.</p>
                              <p>When a <code>ns</code> is not provided, its value should be assumed to be <code>http://csrc.nist.gov/ns/oscal</code> and the name should be a name defined by the associated OSCAL model.</p>
                           </div>
                        </details>
                     </div>

                        <div class="remarks">
                           <p>To provide a cryptographic hash for a remote target resource, a local reference to
                              a back matter <code>resource</code> is needed. The resource allows one or more hash values to be provided using the <code>rlink/hash</code> object.</p>
                           <p>The OSCAL <code>link</code> is a roughly based on the HTML <a>link element</a>. </p>

                                 that points to a <code>back-matter</code> <code>resource</code> in the same document.</p>
                              <p>If a local reference using a fragment is used, this will be indicated by a fragment
                                 "#" followed by an identifier which references an identified <code>resource</code> in the document's <code>back-matter</code> or another object that is within the scope of the containing OSCAL document.</p>
                              <p>If an internet resource is used, the <code>href</code> value will be an absolute or relative URI pointing to the location of the referenced

                                 containing the link.</p>
                           </div>
                        </details>
                     </div>

                           <div class="obj-matrix">
                              <p class="obj-name">attribute Property Namespace</p>
                              <p class="occurrence"><span class="cardinality">[0 or 1]</span></p>
                              <p>An attribute of type <a href="link.to.uri">uri</a></p>
                           </div>
                           <p class="description">A namespace qualifying the property's name. This allows different organizations to
                              associate distinct semantics with the same name.</p>
                           
                           --&gt;      
                           
                           --&gt;      
                           
                           --&gt;      
                           <details open="open" class="remarks-group">
                              <summary>Remarks</summary>
                              <div class="remarks">
                                 <p>Provides a means to segment the value space for the <code>name</code>, so that different organizations and individuals can assert control over the allowed
                                    names and associated values used in a property. This allows the semantics associated
                                    with a given name/value pair to be defined on an organization-by-organization basis.</p>
                                 <p>An organization MUST use a URI that they have control over. e.g., a domain registered
                                    to the organization in a URI, a registered uniform resource names (URN) namespace.</p>
                                 <p>When a <code>ns</code> is not provided, its value should be assumed to be <code>http://csrc.nist.gov/ns/oscal</code> and the name should be a name defined by the associated OSCAL model.</p>
                              </div>
                           </details>
                        </div>
                     </section>

                           <summary>Remarks</summary>
                           <div class="remarks">
                              <p>To provide a cryptographic hash for a remote target resource, a local reference to
                                 a back matter <code>resource</code> is needed. The resource allows one or more hash values to be provided using the <code>rlink/hash</code> object.</p>
                              <p>The OSCAL <code>link</code> is a roughly based on the HTML <a>link element</a>. </p>
                           </div>
                        </details>
