                           <details open="open" class="remarks-group">
                              <summary>Remarks</summary>
                              <div class="remarks">
                                 <p>The value of the <code>href</code> can be an internet resource, or a local reference using a fragment e.g. #fragment
                                    that points to a <code>back-matter</code> <code>resource</code> in the same document.</p>
                                 <p>If a local reference using a fragment is used, this will be indicated by a fragment
                                    "#" followed by an identifier which references an identified <code>resource</code> in the document's <code>back-matter</code> or another object that is within the scope of the containing OSCAL document.</p>
                                 <p>If an internet resource is used, the <code>href</code> value will be an absolute or relative URI pointing to the location of the referenced
                                    resource. A relative URI will be resolved relative to the location of the document
                                    containing the link.</p>
                              </div>
                           </details>

                     <p class="description">Identifies system elements being assessed, such as components, inventory items, and

                        the assessment results this is an actual assessment subject, and reflects any changes

                        identified in this way are out-of-scope.</p>

                           <p>An element </p>
                        </div>
                        <p class="description">An attribute, characteristic, or quality of the containing object expressed as a namespace
                           qualified name/value pair. The value of a property is a simple scalar value, which
                           may be expressed as a list of values.</p>
                        
                        --&gt;      
                        
                        --&gt;      
                        <details open="open" class="remarks-group">
                           <summary>Remarks</summary>
                           <div class="remarks">
                              <p>Properties permit the deployment and management of arbitrary controlled values, within
                                 OSCAL objects. A property can be included for any purpose useful to an application
                                 or implementation. Typically, properties will be used to sort, filter, select, order,
                                 and arrange OSCAL content objects, to relate OSCAL objects to one another, or to associate
                                 an OSCAL object to class hierarchies, taxonomies, or external authorities. Thus, the
                                 lexical composition of properties may be constrained by external processes to ensure
                                 consistency.</p>
                              <p>Property allows for associated remarks that describe why the specific property value
                                 was applied to the containing object, or the significance of the value in the context
                                 of the containing object.</p>
                           </div>
                        </details>
                     </div>

                              <summary>Remarks</summary>

                                 <p>Provides a means to segment the value space for the <code>name</code>, so that different organizations and individuals can assert control over the allowed

                                 <p>An organization MUST use a URI that they have control over. e.g., a domain registered
                                    to the organization in a URI, a registered uniform resource names (URN) namespace.</p>
                                 <p>When a <code>ns</code> is not provided, its value should be assumed to be <code>http://csrc.nist.gov/ns/oscal</code> and the name should be a name defined by the associated OSCAL model.</p>
                              </div>
                           </details>

                        <details open="open" class="remarks-group">
                           <summary>Remarks</summary>
                           <div class="remarks">
                              <p>To provide a cryptographic hash for a remote target resource, a local reference to
                                 a back matter <code>resource</code> is needed. The resource allows one or more hash values to be provided using the <code>rlink/hash</code> object.</p>
                              <p>The OSCAL <code>link</code> is a roughly based on the HTML <a>link element</a>. </p>

                              <div class="remarks">

                                    that points to a <code>back-matter</code> <code>resource</code> in the same document.</p>
                                 <p>If a local reference using a fragment is used, this will be indicated by a fragment
                                    "#" followed by an identifier which references an identified <code>resource</code> in the document's <code>back-matter</code> or another object that is within the scope of the containing OSCAL document.</p>
                                 <p>If an internet resource is used, the <code>href</code> value will be an absolute or relative URI pointing to the location of the referenced
                                    resource. A relative URI will be resolved relative to the location of the document
                                    containing the link.</p>
                              </div>
                           </details>
                        </div>

                              <p class="occurrence"><span class="cardinality">[0 to ∞]</span></p>
                              <p>An element </p>
                           </div>
                           <p class="description">An attribute, characteristic, or quality of the containing object expressed as a namespace
                              qualified name/value pair. The value of a property is a simple scalar value, which
                              may be expressed as a list of values.</p>
                           
                           --&gt;      
                           
                           --&gt;      
                           <details open="open" class="remarks-group">
                              <summary>Remarks</summary>
                              <div class="remarks">
                                 <p>Properties permit the deployment and management of arbitrary controlled values, within
                                    OSCAL objects. A property can be included for any purpose useful to an application
                                    or implementation. Typically, properties will be used to sort, filter, select, order,
                                    and arrange OSCAL content objects, to relate OSCAL objects to one another, or to associate
                                    an OSCAL object to class hierarchies, taxonomies, or external authorities. Thus, the
                                    lexical composition of properties may be constrained by external processes to ensure
                                    consistency.</p>
                                 <p>Property allows for associated remarks that describe why the specific property value
                                    was applied to the containing object, or the significance of the value in the context
                                    of the containing object.</p>
                              </div>
                           </details>
                        </div>

                           </div>
                           <p>See <a href="../xml-outline/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/origin/related-task/subject/include-subject/prop/@ns">/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/origin/related-task/subject/include-subject/prop/@ns</a> in the element map.</p>

                                 <p class="occurrence"><span class="cardinality">[0 or 1]</span></p>

                              </div>
                              <p class="description">A namespace qualifying the property's name. This allows different organizations to
                                 associate distinct semantics with the same name.</p>
                              
                              --&gt;      
                              
                              --&gt;      
                              <details open="open" class="remarks-group">
                                 <summary>Remarks</summary>
                                 <div class="remarks">
                                    <p>Provides a means to segment the value space for the <code>name</code>, so that different organizations and individuals can assert control over the allowed
                                       names and associated values used in a property. This allows the semantics associated

                              <p>An element </p>
                           </div>
                           <p class="description">An attribute, characteristic, or quality of the containing object expressed as a namespace
                              qualified name/value pair. The value of a property is a simple scalar value, which
                              may be expressed as a list of values.</p>

                           <details open="open" class="remarks-group">
                              <summary>Remarks</summary>
                              <div class="remarks">
                                 <p>Properties permit the deployment and management of arbitrary controlled values, within
                                    OSCAL objects. A property can be included for any purpose useful to an application
                                    or implementation. Typically, properties will be used to sort, filter, select, order,
                                    and arrange OSCAL content objects, to relate OSCAL objects to one another, or to associate
                                    an OSCAL object to class hierarchies, taxonomies, or external authorities. Thus, the
                                    lexical composition of properties may be constrained by external processes to ensure
                                    consistency.</p>
                                 <p>Property allows for associated remarks that describe why the specific property value
                                    was applied to the containing object, or the significance of the value in the context
                                    of the containing object.</p>
                              </div>
                           </details>
                        </div>

                              </div>
                              <p class="description">A namespace qualifying the property's name. This allows different organizations to
                                 associate distinct semantics with the same name.</p>
                              
                              --&gt;

                              <details open="open" class="remarks-group">
                                 <summary>Remarks</summary>
                                 <div class="remarks">
                                    <p>Provides a means to segment the value space for the <code>name</code>, so that different organizations and individuals can assert control over the allowed
                                       names and associated values used in a property. This allows the semantics associated

                                    <p>When a <code>ns</code> is not provided, its value should be assumed to be <code>http://csrc.nist.gov/ns/oscal</code> and the name should be a name defined by the associated OSCAL model.</p>

                              <summary>Remarks</summary>
                              <div class="remarks">
                                 <p>To provide a cryptographic hash for a remote target resource, a local reference to
                                    a back matter <code>resource</code> is needed. The resource allows one or more hash values to be provided using the <code>rlink/hash</code> object.</p>
                                 <p>The OSCAL <code>link</code> is a roughly based on the HTML <a>link element</a>. </p>
                              </div>
                           </details>
                        </div>

                                 <p class="occurrence"><span class="cardinality">[1]</span></p>
                                 <p>An attribute of type <a href="link.to.uri-reference">uri-reference</a></p>
                              </div>
                              <p class="description">A resolvable URL reference to a resource.</p>
                              
                              --&gt;

                              --&gt;      
                              <details open="open" class="remarks-group">
                                 <summary>Remarks</summary>
                                 <div class="remarks">
                                    <p>The value of the <code>href</code> can be an internet resource, or a local reference using a fragment e.g. #fragment
                                       that points to a <code>back-matter</code> <code>resource</code> in the same document.</p>
                                    <p>If a local reference using a fragment is used, this will be indicated by a fragment
                                       "#" followed by an identifier which references an identified <code>resource</code> in the document's <code>back-matter</code> or another object that is within the scope of the containing OSCAL document.</p>
                                    <p>If an internet resource is used, the <code>href</code> value will be an absolute or relative URI pointing to the location of the referenced
                                       resource. A relative URI will be resolved relative to the location of the document
                                       containing the link.</p>
                                 </div>
                              </details>
                           </div>
                        </section>

                        <div class="crosslink"><a href="../json-reference/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risks/origins/related-tasks/identified-subject/subjects"><button class="schema-link">Switch to JSON</button></a></div>
                        <h6 id="/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject" class="toc6 head">subject</h6>
                     </div>
                     <p>See <a href="../xml-outline/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject">/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject</a> in the element map.</p>
                     <div class="obj-desc">
                        <div class="obj-matrix">
                           <p class="obj-name">element Subject of Assessment</p>
                           <p class="occurrence"><span class="cardinality">[1 to ∞]</span></p>
                           <p>An element </p>
                        </div>
                        <p class="description">Identifies system elements being assessed, such as components, inventory items, and
                           locations. In the assessment plan, this identifies a planned assessment subject. In
                           the assessment results this is an actual assessment subject, and reflects any changes
                           from the plan. exactly what will be the focus of this assessment. Any subjects not
                           identified in this way are out-of-scope.</p>
                        
                        --&gt;      
                        
                        --&gt;      
                        <details open="open" class="remarks-group">
                           <summary>Remarks</summary>
                           <div class="remarks in-use">
                              <p class="nb">(In use)</p>
                              <p>The assessment subjects that the task identified, which will be used by another task
                                 through a subject-placeholder reference. Such a task will "consume" these subjects.</p>
                           </div>
                           <div class="remarks">
                              <p>Processing of an include/exclude pair starts with processing the include, then removing
                                 matching entries in the exclude.</p>
                           </div>
                        </details>
                     </div>

                        </div>
                        <p>See <a href="../xml-outline/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/description">/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/description</a> in the element map.</p>

                     <section class="xml-element">
                        <div class="header">
                           <div class="crosslink"><a href="../json-reference/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risks/origins/related-tasks/identified-subject/subjects/props"><button class="schema-link">Switch to JSON</button></a></div>
                           <h7 id="/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/prop" class="toc7 head">prop</h7>
                        </div>
                        <p>See <a href="../xml-outline/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/prop">/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/prop</a> in the element map.</p>
                        <div class="obj-desc">
                           <div class="obj-matrix">
                              <p class="obj-name">element Property</p>
                              <p class="occurrence"><span class="cardinality">[0 to ∞]</span></p>
                              <p>An element </p>
                           </div>
                           <p class="description">An attribute, characteristic, or quality of the containing object expressed as a namespace
                              qualified name/value pair. The value of a property is a simple scalar value, which
                              may be expressed as a list of values.</p>
                           
                           --&gt;      
                           
                           --&gt;      
                           <details open="open" class="remarks-group">
                              <summary>Remarks</summary>
                              <div class="remarks">
                                 <p>Properties permit the deployment and management of arbitrary controlled values, within
                                    OSCAL objects. A property can be included for any purpose useful to an application
                                    or implementation. Typically, properties will be used to sort, filter, select, order,
                                    and arrange OSCAL content objects, to relate OSCAL objects to one another, or to associate
                                    an OSCAL object to class hierarchies, taxonomies, or external authorities. Thus, the
                                    lexical composition of properties may be constrained by external processes to ensure
                                    consistency.</p>
                                 <p>Property allows for associated remarks that describe why the specific property value
                                    was applied to the containing object, or the significance of the value in the context
                                    of the containing object.</p>
                              </div>
                           </details>
                        </div>
                        <section class="xml-element">

                           <div class="obj-desc">
                              <div class="obj-matrix">

                              </div>

                                 quality of the property's containing object.</p>
                              
                              --&gt;      
                              
                              --&gt;      
                              
                              --&gt;      </div>
                        </section>
                        <section class="xml-element">
                           <div class="header">
                              <div class="crosslink"><a href="../json-reference/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risks/origins/related-tasks/identified-subject/subjects/props/uuid"><button class="schema-link">Switch to JSON</button></a></div>
                              <h8 id="/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/prop/@uuid" class="toc8 head">@uuid</h8>
                           </div>
                           <p>See <a href="../xml-outline/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/prop/@uuid">/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/prop/@uuid</a> in the element map.</p>
                           <div class="obj-desc">
                              <div class="obj-matrix">
                                 <p class="obj-name">attribute Property Universally Unique Identifier</p>
                                 <p class="occurrence"><span class="cardinality">[0 or 1]</span></p>
                                 <p>An attribute of type <a href="link.to.uuid">uuid</a></p>
                              </div>
                              <p class="description">A unique identifier that can be used to reference this property elsewhere in an OSCAL
                                 document. A UUID should be consistently used for a given location across revisions
                                 of the document.</p>
                              
                              --&gt;      
                              
                              --&gt;      </div>
                        </section>
                        <section class="xml-element">
                           <div class="header">
                              <div class="crosslink"><a href="../json-reference/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risks/origins/related-tasks/identified-subject/subjects/props/ns"><button class="schema-link">Switch to JSON</button></a></div>
                              <h8 id="/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/prop/@ns" class="toc8 head">@ns</h8>
                           </div>
                           <p>See <a href="../xml-outline/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/prop/@ns">/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/prop/@ns</a> in the element map.</p>
                           <div class="obj-desc">
                              <div class="obj-matrix">
                                 <p class="obj-name">attribute Property Namespace</p>
                                 <p class="occurrence"><span class="cardinality">[0 or 1]</span></p>
                                 <p>An attribute of type <a href="link.to.uri">uri</a></p>
                              </div>
                              <p class="description">A namespace qualifying the property's name. This allows different organizations to
                                 associate distinct semantics with the same name.</p>
                              
                              --&gt;      
                              
                              --&gt;      
                              <details open="open" class="remarks-group">
                                 <summary>Remarks</summary>
                                 <div class="remarks">
                                    <p>Provides a means to segment the value space for the <code>name</code>, so that different organizations and individuals can assert control over the allowed
                                       names and associated values used in a property. This allows the semantics associated
                                       with a given name/value pair to be defined on an organization-by-organization basis.</p>
                                    <p>An organization MUST use a URI that they have control over. e.g., a domain registered
                                       to the organization in a URI, a registered uniform resource names (URN) namespace.</p>
                                    <p>When a <code>ns</code> is not provided, its value should be assumed to be <code>http://csrc.nist.gov/ns/oscal</code> and the name should be a name defined by the associated OSCAL model.</p>
                                 </div>
                              </details>
                           </div>
                        </section>

                        <p>See <a href="../xml-outline/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/link">/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/link</a> in the element map.</p>
                        <div class="obj-desc">

                           --&gt;

                           --&gt;      
                           <details open="open" class="remarks-group">
                              <summary>Remarks</summary>
                              <div class="remarks">
                                 <p>To provide a cryptographic hash for a remote target resource, a local reference to
                                    a back matter <code>resource</code> is needed. The resource allows one or more hash values to be provided using the <code>rlink/hash</code> object.</p>
                                 <p>The OSCAL <code>link</code> is a roughly based on the HTML <a>link element</a>. </p>
                              </div>
                           </details>
                        </div>
                        <section class="xml-element">
                           <div class="header">

                                 <p class="occurrence"><span class="cardinality">[1]</span></p>
                                 <p>An attribute of type <a href="link.to.uri-reference">uri-reference</a></p>
                              </div>

                              --&gt;      
                              
                              --&gt;      
                              
                              --&gt;      
                              <details open="open" class="remarks-group">
                                 <summary>Remarks</summary>
                                 <div class="remarks">
                                    <p>The value of the <code>href</code> can be an internet resource, or a local reference using a fragment e.g. #fragment
                                       that points to a <code>back-matter</code> <code>resource</code> in the same document.</p>
                                    <p>If a local reference using a fragment is used, this will be indicated by a fragment
                                       "#" followed by an identifier which references an identified <code>resource</code> in the document's <code>back-matter</code> or another object that is within the scope of the containing OSCAL document.</p>
                                    <p>If an internet resource is used, the <code>href</code> value will be an absolute or relative URI pointing to the location of the referenced
                                       resource. A relative URI will be resolved relative to the location of the document
                                       containing the link.</p>
                                 </div>
                              </details>
                           </div>
                        </section>

                              <h8 id="/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/include-subject/prop" class="toc8 head">prop</h8>
                           </div>
                           <p>See <a href="../xml-outline/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/include-subject/prop">/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/include-subject/prop</a> in the element map.</p>
                           <div class="obj-desc">
                              <div class="obj-matrix">
                                 <p class="obj-name">element Property</p>
                                 <p class="occurrence"><span class="cardinality">[0 to ∞]</span></p>
                                 <p>An element </p>
                              </div>
                              <p class="description">An attribute, characteristic, or quality of the containing object expressed as a namespace
                                 qualified name/value pair. The value of a property is a simple scalar value, which
                                 may be expressed as a list of values.</p>
                              
                              --&gt;      
                              
                              --&gt;      
                              <details open="open" class="remarks-group">
                                 <summary>Remarks</summary>
                                 <div class="remarks">
                                    <p>Properties permit the deployment and management of arbitrary controlled values, within
                                       OSCAL objects. A property can be included for any purpose useful to an application
                                       or implementation. Typically, properties will be used to sort, filter, select, order,
                                       and arrange OSCAL content objects, to relate OSCAL objects to one another, or to associate
                                       an OSCAL object to class hierarchies, taxonomies, or external authorities. Thus, the
                                       lexical composition of properties may be constrained by external processes to ensure
                                       consistency.</p>
                                    <p>Property allows for associated remarks that describe why the specific property value
                                       was applied to the containing object, or the significance of the value in the context
                                       of the containing object.</p>
                                 </div>
                              </details>
                           </div>

                                    quality of the property's containing object.</p>
                                 
                                 --&gt;      
                                 
                                 --&gt;      
                                 
                                 --&gt;      </div>
                           </section>
                           <section class="xml-element">
                              <div class="header">
                                 <div class="crosslink"><a href="../json-reference/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risks/origins/related-tasks/identified-subject/subjects/include-subjects/props/uuid"><button class="schema-link">Switch to JSON</button></a></div>

                              </div>
                              <p>See <a href="../xml-outline/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/include-subject/prop/@uuid">/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/include-subject/prop/@uuid</a> in the element map.</p>

                                 <div class="obj-matrix">
                                    <p class="obj-name">attribute Property Universally Unique Identifier</p>
                                    <p class="occurrence"><span class="cardinality">[0 or 1]</span></p>
                                    <p>An attribute of type <a href="link.to.uuid">uuid</a></p>
                                 </div>
                                 <p class="description">A unique identifier that can be used to reference this property elsewhere in an OSCAL
                                    document. A UUID should be consistently used for a given location across revisions
                                    of the document.</p>
                                 
                                 --&gt;      
                                 
                                 --&gt;      </div>
                           </section>
                           <section class="xml-element">
                              <div class="header">
                                 <div class="crosslink"><a href="../json-reference/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risks/origins/related-tasks/identified-subject/subjects/include-subjects/props/ns"><button class="schema-link">Switch to JSON</button></a></div>
                                 <h9 id="/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/include-subject/prop/@ns" class="toc9 head">@ns</h9>
                              </div>
                              <p>See <a href="../xml-outline/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/include-subject/prop/@ns">/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/include-subject/prop/@ns</a> in the element map.</p>
                              <div class="obj-desc">
                                 <div class="obj-matrix">
                                    <p class="obj-name">attribute Property Namespace</p>
                                    <p class="occurrence"><span class="cardinality">[0 or 1]</span></p>
                                    <p>An attribute of type <a href="link.to.uri">uri</a></p>
                                 </div>
                                 <p class="description">A namespace qualifying the property's name. This allows different organizations to
                                    associate distinct semantics with the same name.</p>
                                 
                                 --&gt;      
                                 
                                 --&gt;      
                                 <details open="open" class="remarks-group">
                                    <summary>Remarks</summary>
                                    <div class="remarks">
                                       <p>Provides a means to segment the value space for the <code>name</code>, so that different organizations and individuals can assert control over the allowed
                                          names and associated values used in a property. This allows the semantics associated
                                          with a given name/value pair to be defined on an organization-by-organization basis.</p>
                                       <p>An organization MUST use a URI that they have control over. e.g., a domain registered
                                          to the organization in a URI, a registered uniform resource names (URN) namespace.</p>
                                       <p>When a <code>ns</code> is not provided, its value should be assumed to be <code>http://csrc.nist.gov/ns/oscal</code> and the name should be a name defined by the associated OSCAL model.</p>
                                    </div>
                                 </details>
                              </div>
                           </section>

                              <details open="open" class="remarks-group">
                                 <summary>Remarks</summary>
                                 <div class="remarks">
                                    <p>To provide a cryptographic hash for a remote target resource, a local reference to
                                       a back matter <code>resource</code> is needed. The resource allows one or more hash values to be provided using the <code>rlink/hash</code> object.</p>
                                    <p>The OSCAL <code>link</code> is a roughly based on the HTML <a>link element</a>. </p>
                                 </div>
                              </details>

                           <section class="xml-element">

                                 <details open="open" class="remarks-group">
                                    <summary>Remarks</summary>
                                    <div class="remarks">
                                       <p>The value of the <code>href</code> can be an internet resource, or a local reference using a fragment e.g. #fragment
                                          that points to a <code>back-matter</code> <code>resource</code> in the same document.</p>
                                       <p>If a local reference using a fragment is used, this will be indicated by a fragment
                                          "#" followed by an identifier which references an identified <code>resource</code> in the document's <code>back-matter</code> or another object that is within the scope of the containing OSCAL document.</p>
                                       <p>If an internet resource is used, the <code>href</code> value will be an absolute or relative URI pointing to the location of the referenced
                                          resource. A relative URI will be resolved relative to the location of the document
                                          containing the link.</p>
                                    </div>
                                 </details>
                              </div>

                              <h8 id="/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/exclude-subject/prop" class="toc8 head">prop</h8>
                           </div>
                           <p>See <a href="../xml-outline/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/exclude-subject/prop">/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/exclude-subject/prop</a> in the element map.</p>
                           <div class="obj-desc">

                                 <p class="occurrence"><span class="cardinality">[0 to ∞]</span></p>
                                 <p>An element </p>
                              </div>
                              <p class="description">An attribute, characteristic, or quality of the containing object expressed as a namespace
                                 qualified name/value pair. The value of a property is a simple scalar value, which
                                 may be expressed as a list of values.</p>
                              
                              --&gt;      
                              
                              --&gt;      
                              <details open="open" class="remarks-group">
                                 <summary>Remarks</summary>
                                 <div class="remarks">
                                    <p>Properties permit the deployment and management of arbitrary controlled values, within
                                       OSCAL objects. A property can be included for any purpose useful to an application
                                       or implementation. Typically, properties will be used to sort, filter, select, order,
                                       and arrange OSCAL content objects, to relate OSCAL objects to one another, or to associate
                                       an OSCAL object to class hierarchies, taxonomies, or external authorities. Thus, the
                                       lexical composition of properties may be constrained by external processes to ensure
                                       consistency.</p>
                                    <p>Property allows for associated remarks that describe why the specific property value
                                       was applied to the containing object, or the significance of the value in the context
                                       of the containing object.</p>
                                 </div>
                              </details>
                           </div>

                                    quality of the property's containing object.</p>
                                 
                                 --&gt;

                                 --&gt;      </div>
                           </section>
                           <section class="xml-element">
                              <div class="header">
                                 <div class="crosslink"><a href="../json-reference/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risks/origins/related-tasks/identified-subject/subjects/exclude-subjects/props/uuid"><button class="schema-link">Switch to JSON</button></a></div>

                              </div>

                                    <p>An attribute of type <a href="link.to.uuid">uuid</a></p>
                                 </div>
                                 <p class="description">A unique identifier that can be used to reference this property elsewhere in an OSCAL
                                    document. A UUID should be consistently used for a given location across revisions
                                    of the document.</p>

                           <section class="xml-element">
                              <div class="header">
                                 <div class="crosslink"><a href="../json-reference/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risks/origins/related-tasks/identified-subject/subjects/exclude-subjects/props/ns"><button class="schema-link">Switch to JSON</button></a></div>
                                 <h9 id="/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/exclude-subject/prop/@ns" class="toc9 head">@ns</h9>
                              </div>
                              <p>See <a href="../xml-outline/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/exclude-subject/prop/@ns">/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/exclude-subject/prop/@ns</a> in the element map.</p>
                              <div class="obj-desc">
                                 <div class="obj-matrix">
                                    <p class="obj-name">attribute Property Namespace</p>
                                    <p class="occurrence"><span class="cardinality">[0 or 1]</span></p>
                                    <p>An attribute of type <a href="link.to.uri">uri</a></p>
                                 </div>
                                 <p class="description">A namespace qualifying the property's name. This allows different organizations to
                                    associate distinct semantics with the same name.</p>
                                 
                                 --&gt;      
                                 
                                 --&gt;      
                                 <details open="open" class="remarks-group">
                                    <summary>Remarks</summary>
                                    <div class="remarks">
                                       <p>Provides a means to segment the value space for the <code>name</code>, so that different organizations and individuals can assert control over the allowed
                                          names and associated values used in a property. This allows the semantics associated
                                          with a given name/value pair to be defined on an organization-by-organization basis.</p>
                                       <p>An organization MUST use a URI that they have control over. e.g., a domain registered
                                          to the organization in a URI, a registered uniform resource names (URN) namespace.</p>
                                       <p>When a <code>ns</code> is not provided, its value should be assumed to be <code>http://csrc.nist.gov/ns/oscal</code> and the name should be a name defined by the associated OSCAL model.</p>
                                    </div>
                                 </details>
                              </div>

                                 <summary>Remarks</summary>
                                 <div class="remarks">
                                    <p>To provide a cryptographic hash for a remote target resource, a local reference to

                                    <p>The OSCAL <code>link</code> is a roughly based on the HTML <a>link element</a>. </p>
                                 </div>

                              <div class="obj-desc">

                                    <p class="occurrence"><span class="cardinality">[1]</span></p>
                                    <p>An attribute of type <a href="link.to.uri-reference">uri-reference</a></p>

                                 --&gt;      
                                 <details open="open" class="remarks-group">
                                    <summary>Remarks</summary>
                                    <div class="remarks">
                                       <p>The value of the <code>href</code> can be an internet resource, or a local reference using a fragment e.g. #fragment
                                          that points to a <code>back-matter</code> <code>resource</code> in the same document.</p>
                                       <p>If a local reference using a fragment is used, this will be indicated by a fragment
                                          "#" followed by an identifier which references an identified <code>resource</code> in the document's <code>back-matter</code> or another object that is within the scope of the containing OSCAL document.</p>
                                       <p>If an internet resource is used, the <code>href</code> value will be an absolute or relative URI pointing to the location of the referenced
                                          resource. A relative URI will be resolved relative to the location of the document
                                          containing the link.</p>
                                    </div>
                                 </details>
                              </div>

            <div class="header">
               <div class="crosslink"><a href="../json-reference/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risks/characterizations"><button class="schema-link">Switch to JSON</button></a></div>
               <h3 id="/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization" class="toc3 head">characterization</h3>
            </div>
            <p>See <a href="../xml-outline/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization">/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization</a> in the element map.</p>
            <div class="obj-desc">
               <div class="obj-matrix">
                  <p class="obj-name">element Characterization</p>
                  <p class="occurrence"><span class="cardinality">[0 to ∞]</span></p>
                  <p>An element </p>
               </div>
               <p class="description">A collection of descriptive data about the containing object from a specific origin.</p>
               
               --&gt;      </div>
            <section class="xml-element">
               <div class="header">
                  <div class="crosslink"><a href="../json-reference/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risks/characterizations/props"><button class="schema-link">Switch to JSON</button></a></div>
                  <h4 id="/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/prop" class="toc4 head">prop</h4>
               </div>
               <p>See <a href="../xml-outline/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/prop">/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/prop</a> in the element map.</p>
               <div class="obj-desc">
                  <div class="obj-matrix">
                     <p class="obj-name">element Property</p>
                     <p class="occurrence"><span class="cardinality">[0 to ∞]</span></p>
                     <p>An element </p>
                  </div>
                  <p class="description">An attribute, characteristic, or quality of the containing object expressed as a namespace
                     qualified name/value pair. The value of a property is a simple scalar value, which
                     may be expressed as a list of values.</p>
                  
                  --&gt;      
                  <details open="open" class="remarks-group">
                     <summary>Remarks</summary>
                     <div class="remarks">
                        <p>Properties permit the deployment and management of arbitrary controlled values, within
                           OSCAL objects. A property can be included for any purpose useful to an application
                           or implementation. Typically, properties will be used to sort, filter, select, order,
                           and arrange OSCAL content objects, to relate OSCAL objects to one another, or to associate
                           an OSCAL object to class hierarchies, taxonomies, or external authorities. Thus, the
                           lexical composition of properties may be constrained by external processes to ensure
                           consistency.</p>
                        <p>Property allows for associated remarks that describe why the specific property value
                           was applied to the containing object, or the significance of the value in the context
                           of the containing object.</p>
                     </div>
                  </details>
               </div>
               <section class="xml-element">
                  <div class="header">
                     <div class="crosslink"><a href="../json-reference/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risks/characterizations/props/name"><button class="schema-link">Switch to JSON</button></a></div>
                     <h5 id="/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/prop/@name" class="toc5 head">@name</h5>
                  </div>
                  <p>See <a href="../xml-outline/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/prop/@name">/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/prop/@name</a> in the element map.</p>
                  <div class="obj-desc">
                     <div class="obj-matrix">
                        <p class="obj-name">attribute Property Name</p>
                        <p class="occurrence"><span class="cardinality">[1]</span></p>
                        <p>An attribute of type <a href="link.to.NCName">NCName</a></p>
                     </div>
                     <p class="description">A textual label that uniquely identifies a specific attribute, characteristic, or
                        quality of the property's containing object.</p>
                     
                     --&gt;      
                     
                     --&gt;      </div>
               </section>
               <section class="xml-element">
                  <div class="header">
                     <div class="crosslink"><a href="../json-reference/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risks/characterizations/props/uuid"><button class="schema-link">Switch to JSON</button></a></div>
                     <h5 id="/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/prop/@uuid" class="toc5 head">@uuid</h5>
                  </div>
                  <p>See <a href="../xml-outline/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/prop/@uuid">/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/prop/@uuid</a> in the element map.</p>
                  <div class="obj-desc">
                     <div class="obj-matrix">
                        <p class="obj-name">attribute Property Universally Unique Identifier</p>
                        <p class="occurrence"><span class="cardinality">[0 or 1]</span></p>
                        <p>An attribute of type <a href="link.to.uuid">uuid</a></p>
                     </div>
                     <p class="description">A unique identifier that can be used to reference this property elsewhere in an OSCAL
                        document. A UUID should be consistently used for a given location across revisions
                        of the document.</p>
                     
                     --&gt;      </div>
               </section>
               <section class="xml-element">
                  <div class="header">
                     <div class="crosslink"><a href="../json-reference/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risks/characterizations/props/ns"><button class="schema-link">Switch to JSON</button></a></div>
                     <h5 id="/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/prop/@ns" class="toc5 head">@ns</h5>
                  </div>
                  <p>See <a href="../xml-outline/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/prop/@ns">/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/prop/@ns</a> in the element map.</p>
                  <div class="obj-desc">
                     <div class="obj-matrix">
                        <p class="obj-name">attribute Property Namespace</p>
                        <p class="occurrence"><span class="cardinality">[0 or 1]</span></p>
                        <p>An attribute of type <a href="link.to.uri">uri</a></p>
                     </div>
                     <p class="description">A namespace qualifying the property's name. This allows different organizations to
                        associate distinct semantics with the same name.</p>
                     
                     --&gt;      
                     <details open="open" class="remarks-group">
                        <summary>Remarks</summary>
                        <div class="remarks">
                           <p>Provides a means to segment the value space for the <code>name</code>, so that different organizations and individuals can assert control over the allowed
                              names and associated values used in a property. This allows the semantics associated
                              with a given name/value pair to be defined on an organization-by-organization basis.</p>
                           <p>An organization MUST use a URI that they have control over. e.g., a domain registered
                              to the organization in a URI, a registered uniform resource names (URN) namespace.</p>
                           <p>When a <code>ns</code> is not provided, its value should be assumed to be <code>http://csrc.nist.gov/ns/oscal</code> and the name should be a name defined by the associated OSCAL model.</p>
                        </div>
                     </details>
                  </div>
               </section>
               <section class="xml-element">
                  <div class="header">
                     <div class="crosslink"><a href="../json-reference/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risks/characterizations/props/value"><button class="schema-link">Switch to JSON</button></a></div>

               <div class="obj-desc">

                  --&gt;

                  <details open="open" class="remarks-group">
                     <summary>Remarks</summary>
                     <div class="remarks">
                        <p>To provide a cryptographic hash for a remote target resource, a local reference to
                           a back matter <code>resource</code> is needed. The resource allows one or more hash values to be provided using the <code>rlink/hash</code> object.</p>
                        <p>The OSCAL <code>link</code> is a roughly based on the HTML <a>link element</a>. </p>

               <section class="xml-element">

                     </div>

                     --&gt;      
                     
                     --&gt;      
                     <details open="open" class="remarks-group">
                        <summary>Remarks</summary>
                        <div class="remarks">
                           <p>The value of the <code>href</code> can be an internet resource, or a local reference using a fragment e.g. #fragment
                              that points to a <code>back-matter</code> <code>resource</code> in the same document.</p>
                           <p>If a local reference using a fragment is used, this will be indicated by a fragment
                              "#" followed by an identifier which references an identified <code>resource</code> in the document's <code>back-matter</code> or another object that is within the scope of the containing OSCAL document.</p>
                           <p>If an internet resource is used, the <code>href</code> value will be an absolute or relative URI pointing to the location of the referenced
                              resource. A relative URI will be resolved relative to the location of the document
                              containing the link.</p>
                        </div>
                     </details>
                  </div>
               </section>

                           <p>An element </p>
                        </div>
                        <p class="description">An attribute, characteristic, or quality of the containing object expressed as a namespace
                           qualified name/value pair. The value of a property is a simple scalar value, which
                           may be expressed as a list of values.</p>
                        
                        --&gt;      
                        <details open="open" class="remarks-group">
                           <summary>Remarks</summary>
                           <div class="remarks">
                              <p>Properties permit the deployment and management of arbitrary controlled values, within
                                 OSCAL objects. A property can be included for any purpose useful to an application
                                 or implementation. Typically, properties will be used to sort, filter, select, order,
                                 and arrange OSCAL content objects, to relate OSCAL objects to one another, or to associate
                                 an OSCAL object to class hierarchies, taxonomies, or external authorities. Thus, the
                                 lexical composition of properties may be constrained by external processes to ensure
                                 consistency.</p>
                              <p>Property allows for associated remarks that describe why the specific property value
                                 was applied to the containing object, or the significance of the value in the context
                                 of the containing object.</p>
                           </div>
                        </details>
                     </div>

                        </div>

                        <div class="obj-desc">
                           <div class="obj-matrix">
                              <p class="obj-name">attribute Property Namespace</p>
                              <p class="occurrence"><span class="cardinality">[0 or 1]</span></p>
                              <p>An attribute of type <a href="link.to.uri">uri</a></p>
                           </div>
                           <p class="description">A namespace qualifying the property's name. This allows different organizations to
                              associate distinct semantics with the same name.</p>
                           
                           --&gt;      
                           <details open="open" class="remarks-group">
                              <summary>Remarks</summary>
                              <div class="remarks">
                                 <p>Provides a means to segment the value space for the <code>name</code>, so that different organizations and individuals can assert control over the allowed
                                    names and associated values used in a property. This allows the semantics associated
                                    with a given name/value pair to be defined on an organization-by-organization basis.</p>
                                 <p>An organization MUST use a URI that they have control over. e.g., a domain registered
                                    to the organization in a URI, a registered uniform resource names (URN) namespace.</p>
                                 <p>When a <code>ns</code> is not provided, its value should be assumed to be <code>http://csrc.nist.gov/ns/oscal</code> and the name should be a name defined by the associated OSCAL model.</p>
                              </div>
                           </details>

                           <p>An element </p>
                        </div>
                        <p class="description">An attribute, characteristic, or quality of the containing object expressed as a namespace
                           qualified name/value pair. The value of a property is a simple scalar value, which
                           may be expressed as a list of values.</p>
                        
                        --&gt;      
                        
                        --&gt;      
                        <details open="open" class="remarks-group">
                           <summary>Remarks</summary>
                           <div class="remarks">
                              <p>Properties permit the deployment and management of arbitrary controlled values, within
                                 OSCAL objects. A property can be included for any purpose useful to an application
                                 or implementation. Typically, properties will be used to sort, filter, select, order,
                                 and arrange OSCAL content objects, to relate OSCAL objects to one another, or to associate
                                 an OSCAL object to class hierarchies, taxonomies, or external authorities. Thus, the
                                 lexical composition of properties may be constrained by external processes to ensure
                                 consistency.</p>
                              <p>Property allows for associated remarks that describe why the specific property value
                                 was applied to the containing object, or the significance of the value in the context
                                 of the containing object.</p>
                           </div>
                        </details>
                     </div>

                           </div>
                           <p class="description">A namespace qualifying the property's name. This allows different organizations to
                              associate distinct semantics with the same name.</p>

                           <details open="open" class="remarks-group">
                              <summary>Remarks</summary>
                              <div class="remarks">
                                 <p>Provides a means to segment the value space for the <code>name</code>, so that different organizations and individuals can assert control over the allowed

                                 <p>When a <code>ns</code> is not provided, its value should be assumed to be <code>http://csrc.nist.gov/ns/oscal</code> and the name should be a name defined by the associated OSCAL model.</p>

                     <section class="xml-element">
                        <div class="header">
                           <div class="crosslink"><a href="../json-reference/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risks/characterizations/origin/related-tasks/responsible-parties/props"><button class="schema-link">Switch to JSON</button></a></div>
                           <h7 id="/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/origin/related-task/responsible-party/prop" class="toc7 head">prop</h7>
                        </div>
                        <p>See <a href="../xml-outline/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/origin/related-task/responsible-party/prop">/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/origin/related-task/responsible-party/prop</a> in the element map.</p>
                        <div class="obj-desc">
                           <div class="obj-matrix">
                              <p class="obj-name">element Property</p>
                              <p class="occurrence"><span class="cardinality">[0 to ∞]</span></p>
                              <p>An element </p>
                           </div>
                           <p class="description">An attribute, characteristic, or quality of the containing object expressed as a namespace
                              qualified name/value pair. The value of a property is a simple scalar value, which
                              may be expressed as a list of values.</p>
                           
                           --&gt;      
                           
                           --&gt;      
                           
                           --&gt;      
                           <details open="open" class="remarks-group">
                              <summary>Remarks</summary>
                              <div class="remarks">
                                 <p>Properties permit the deployment and management of arbitrary controlled values, within
                                    OSCAL objects. A property can be included for any purpose useful to an application
                                    or implementation. Typically, properties will be used to sort, filter, select, order,
                                    and arrange OSCAL content objects, to relate OSCAL objects to one another, or to associate
                                    an OSCAL object to class hierarchies, taxonomies, or external authorities. Thus, the
                                    lexical composition of properties may be constrained by external processes to ensure
                                    consistency.</p>
                                 <p>Property allows for associated remarks that describe why the specific property value
                                    was applied to the containing object, or the significance of the value in the context
                                    of the containing object.</p>
                              </div>
                           </details>
                        </div>

                           <div class="header">

                                 quality of the property's containing object.</p>
                              
                              --&gt;

                              --&gt;      </div>
                        </section>

                              <div class="crosslink"><a href="../json-reference/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risks/characterizations/origin/related-tasks/responsible-parties/props/uuid"><button class="schema-link">Switch to JSON</button></a></div>
                              <h8 id="/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/origin/related-task/responsible-party/prop/@uuid" class="toc8 head">@uuid</h8>

                              </div>

                        <section class="xml-element">
                           <div class="header">
                              <div class="crosslink"><a href="../json-reference/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risks/characterizations/origin/related-tasks/responsible-parties/props/ns"><button class="schema-link">Switch to JSON</button></a></div>
                              <h8 id="/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/origin/related-task/responsible-party/prop/@ns" class="toc8 head">@ns</h8>
                           </div>
                           <p>See <a href="../xml-outline/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/origin/related-task/responsible-party/prop/@ns">/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/origin/related-task/responsible-party/prop/@ns</a> in the element map.</p>
                           <div class="obj-desc">
                              <div class="obj-matrix">
                                 <p class="obj-name">attribute Property Namespace</p>
                                 <p class="occurrence"><span class="cardinality">[0 or 1]</span></p>
                                 <p>An attribute of type <a href="link.to.uri">uri</a></p>
                              </div>
                              <p class="description">A namespace qualifying the property's name. This allows different organizations to
                                 associate distinct semantics with the same name.</p>
                              
                              --&gt;      
                              
                              --&gt;      
                              
                              --&gt;      
                              <details open="open" class="remarks-group">
                                 <summary>Remarks</summary>
                                 <div class="remarks">
                                    <p>Provides a means to segment the value space for the <code>name</code>, so that different organizations and individuals can assert control over the allowed
                                       names and associated values used in a property. This allows the semantics associated
                                       with a given name/value pair to be defined on an organization-by-organization basis.</p>
                                    <p>An organization MUST use a URI that they have control over. e.g., a domain registered
                                       to the organization in a URI, a registered uniform resource names (URN) namespace.</p>
                                    <p>When a <code>ns</code> is not provided, its value should be assumed to be <code>http://csrc.nist.gov/ns/oscal</code> and the name should be a name defined by the associated OSCAL model.</p>
                                 </div>
                              </details>
                           </div>
                        </section>

                           </div>
                           <p>See <a href="../xml-outline/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/origin/related-task/responsible-party/prop/@value">/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/origin/related-task/responsible-party/prop/@value</a> in the element map.</p>

                              <h8 id="/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/origin/related-task/responsible-party/prop/@class" class="toc8 head">@class</h8>
                           </div>
                           <p>See <a href="../xml-outline/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/origin/related-task/responsible-party/prop/@class">/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/origin/related-task/responsible-party/prop/@class</a> in the element map.</p>

                              </div>
                              <p class="description">A textual label that provides a sub-type or characterization of the property's <code>name</code>. This can be used to further distinguish or discriminate between the semantics of
                                 multiple properties of the same object with the same <code>name</code> and <code>ns</code>. </p>
                              
                              --&gt;

                                 </div>
                              </details>
                           </div>
                        </section>

                     <section class="xml-element">

                        </div>
                        <p>See <a href="../xml-outline/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/origin/related-task/responsible-party/link">/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/origin/related-task/responsible-party/link</a> in the element map.</p>
                        <div class="obj-desc">
                           <div class="obj-matrix">
                              <p class="obj-name">element Link</p>
                              <p class="occurrence"><span class="cardinality">[0 to ∞]</span></p>
                              <p>An element </p>
                           </div>
                           <p class="description">A reference to a local or remote resource</p>
                           
                           --&gt;      
                           
                           --&gt;      
                           
                           --&gt;      
                           
                           --&gt;      
                           <details open="open" class="remarks-group">
                              <summary>Remarks</summary>
                              <div class="remarks">
                                 <p>To provide a cryptographic hash for a remote target resource, a local reference to
                                    a back matter <code>resource</code> is needed. The resource allows one or more hash values to be provided using the <code>rlink/hash</code> object.</p>
                                 <p>The OSCAL <code>link</code> is a roughly based on the HTML <a>link element</a>. </p>
                              </div>
                           </details>
                        </div>
                        <section class="xml-element">
                           <div class="header">

                                 <p class="obj-name">attribute Hypertext Reference</p>
                                 <p class="occurrence"><span class="cardinality">[1]</span></p>
                                 <p>An attribute of type <a href="link.to.uri-reference">uri-reference</a></p>
                              </div>
                              <p class="description">A resolvable URL reference to a resource.</p>
                              
                              --&gt;      
                              
                              --&gt;      
                              
                              --&gt;      
                              
                              --&gt;      
                              <details open="open" class="remarks-group">
                                 <summary>Remarks</summary>
                                 <div class="remarks">
                                    <p>The value of the <code>href</code> can be an internet resource, or a local reference using a fragment e.g. #fragment
                                       that points to a <code>back-matter</code> <code>resource</code> in the same document.</p>
                                    <p>If a local reference using a fragment is used, this will be indicated by a fragment
                                       "#" followed by an identifier which references an identified <code>resource</code> in the document's <code>back-matter</code> or another object that is within the scope of the containing OSCAL document.</p>
                                    <p>If an internet resource is used, the <code>href</code> value will be an absolute or relative URI pointing to the location of the referenced
                                       resource. A relative URI will be resolved relative to the location of the document
                                       containing the link.</p>
                                 </div>
                              </details>
                           </div>
                        </section>

                     </div>
                     <p>See <a href="../xml-outline/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/origin/related-task/subject">/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/origin/related-task/subject</a> in the element map.</p>

                        </div>
                        <p class="description">Identifies system elements being assessed, such as components, inventory items, and

                     <section class="xml-element">
                        <div class="header">
                           <div class="crosslink"><a href="../json-reference/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risks/characterizations/origin/related-tasks/subjects/props"><button class="schema-link">Switch to JSON</button></a></div>
