                        </div>
                        <p>See <a href="../xml-outline/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/origin/related-task/subject/prop">/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/origin/related-task/subject/prop</a> in the element map.</p>
                        <div class="obj-desc">
                           <div class="obj-matrix">
                              <p class="obj-name">element Property</p>
                              <p class="occurrence"><span class="cardinality">[0 to ∞]</span></p>
                              <p>An element </p>
                           </div>
                           <p class="description">An attribute, characteristic, or quality of the containing object expressed as a namespace
                              qualified name/value pair. The value of a property is a simple scalar value, which
                              may be expressed as a list of values.</p>
                           
                           --&gt;      
                           
                           --&gt;      
                           <details open="open" class="remarks-group">
                              <summary>Remarks</summary>
                              <div class="remarks">
                                 <p>Properties permit the deployment and management of arbitrary controlled values, within
                                    OSCAL objects. A property can be included for any purpose useful to an application
                                    or implementation. Typically, properties will be used to sort, filter, select, order,
                                    and arrange OSCAL content objects, to relate OSCAL objects to one another, or to associate
                                    an OSCAL object to class hierarchies, taxonomies, or external authorities. Thus, the
                                    lexical composition of properties may be constrained by external processes to ensure
                                    consistency.</p>
                                 <p>Property allows for associated remarks that describe why the specific property value
                                    was applied to the containing object, or the significance of the value in the context
                                    of the containing object.</p>
                              </div>
                           </details>
                        </div>

                              <h8 id="/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/origin/related-task/subject/prop/@ns" class="toc8 head">@ns</h8>
                           </div>
                           <p>See <a href="../xml-outline/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/origin/related-task/subject/prop/@ns">/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/origin/related-task/subject/prop/@ns</a> in the element map.</p>
                           <div class="obj-desc">
                              <div class="obj-matrix">
                                 <p class="obj-name">attribute Property Namespace</p>
                                 <p class="occurrence"><span class="cardinality">[0 or 1]</span></p>
                                 <p>An attribute of type <a href="link.to.uri">uri</a></p>
                              </div>
                              <p class="description">A namespace qualifying the property's name. This allows different organizations to
                                 associate distinct semantics with the same name.</p>
                              
                              --&gt;      
                              
                              --&gt;      
                              <details open="open" class="remarks-group">
                                 <summary>Remarks</summary>
                                 <div class="remarks">
                                    <p>Provides a means to segment the value space for the <code>name</code>, so that different organizations and individuals can assert control over the allowed
                                       names and associated values used in a property. This allows the semantics associated
                                       with a given name/value pair to be defined on an organization-by-organization basis.</p>
                                    <p>An organization MUST use a URI that they have control over. e.g., a domain registered
                                       to the organization in a URI, a registered uniform resource names (URN) namespace.</p>
                                    <p>When a <code>ns</code> is not provided, its value should be assumed to be <code>http://csrc.nist.gov/ns/oscal</code> and the name should be a name defined by the associated OSCAL model.</p>
                                 </div>
                              </details>
                           </div>
                        </section>

                           <p>See <a href="../xml-outline/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/origin/related-task/subject/prop/@class">/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/origin/related-task/subject/prop/@class</a> in the element map.</p>

                              <p class="description">A textual label that provides a sub-type or characterization of the property's <code>name</code>. This can be used to further distinguish or discriminate between the semantics of

                     <section class="xml-element">

                        </div>
                        <p>See <a href="../xml-outline/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/origin/related-task/subject/link">/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/origin/related-task/subject/link</a> in the element map.</p>
                        <div class="obj-desc">
                           <div class="obj-matrix">
                              <p class="obj-name">element Link</p>
                              <p class="occurrence"><span class="cardinality">[0 to ∞]</span></p>
                              <p>An element </p>
                           </div>

                           --&gt;

                           --&gt;      
                           <details open="open" class="remarks-group">
                              <summary>Remarks</summary>
                              <div class="remarks">
                                 <p>To provide a cryptographic hash for a remote target resource, a local reference to
                                    a back matter <code>resource</code> is needed. The resource allows one or more hash values to be provided using the <code>rlink/hash</code> object.</p>
                                 <p>The OSCAL <code>link</code> is a roughly based on the HTML <a>link element</a>. </p>
                              </div>
                           </details>
                        </div>
                        <section class="xml-element">
                           <div class="header">
                              <div class="crosslink"><a href="../json-reference/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risks/characterizations/origin/related-tasks/subjects/links/href"><button class="schema-link">Switch to JSON</button></a></div>

                                 <p class="occurrence"><span class="cardinality">[1]</span></p>
                                 <p>An attribute of type <a href="link.to.uri-reference">uri-reference</a></p>
                              </div>
                              <p class="description">A resolvable URL reference to a resource.</p>
                              
                              --&gt;      
                              
                              --&gt;      
                              
                              --&gt;      
                              <details open="open" class="remarks-group">
                                 <summary>Remarks</summary>
                                 <div class="remarks">
                                    <p>The value of the <code>href</code> can be an internet resource, or a local reference using a fragment e.g. #fragment
                                       that points to a <code>back-matter</code> <code>resource</code> in the same document.</p>
                                    <p>If a local reference using a fragment is used, this will be indicated by a fragment
                                       "#" followed by an identifier which references an identified <code>resource</code> in the document's <code>back-matter</code> or another object that is within the scope of the containing OSCAL document.</p>
                                    <p>If an internet resource is used, the <code>href</code> value will be an absolute or relative URI pointing to the location of the referenced
                                       resource. A relative URI will be resolved relative to the location of the document
                                       containing the link.</p>
                                 </div>
                              </details>
                           </div>
                        </section>

                              </div>
                              <p class="description">An attribute, characteristic, or quality of the containing object expressed as a namespace

                                       or implementation. Typically, properties will be used to sort, filter, select, order,
                                       and arrange OSCAL content objects, to relate OSCAL objects to one another, or to associate

                                       <p>When a <code>ns</code> is not provided, its value should be assumed to be <code>http://csrc.nist.gov/ns/oscal</code> and the name should be a name defined by the associated OSCAL model.</p>

                                    <div class="remarks">

                                          that points to a <code>back-matter</code> <code>resource</code> in the same document.</p>
                                       <p>If a local reference using a fragment is used, this will be indicated by a fragment
                                          "#" followed by an identifier which references an identified <code>resource</code> in the document's <code>back-matter</code> or another object that is within the scope of the containing OSCAL document.</p>
                                       <p>If an internet resource is used, the <code>href</code> value will be an absolute or relative URI pointing to the location of the referenced
                                          resource. A relative URI will be resolved relative to the location of the document
                                          containing the link.</p>

                              </div>
                              <p class="description">An attribute, characteristic, or quality of the containing object expressed as a namespace
                                 qualified name/value pair. The value of a property is a simple scalar value, which
                                 may be expressed as a list of values.</p>

                                 <div class="remarks">
                                    <p>Properties permit the deployment and management of arbitrary controlled values, within
                                       OSCAL objects. A property can be included for any purpose useful to an application
                                       or implementation. Typically, properties will be used to sort, filter, select, order,
                                       and arrange OSCAL content objects, to relate OSCAL objects to one another, or to associate
                                       an OSCAL object to class hierarchies, taxonomies, or external authorities. Thus, the
                                       lexical composition of properties may be constrained by external processes to ensure
                                       consistency.</p>
                                    <p>Property allows for associated remarks that describe why the specific property value
                                       was applied to the containing object, or the significance of the value in the context
                                       of the containing object.</p>

                                    <p class="occurrence"><span class="cardinality">[0 or 1]</span></p>
                                    <p>An attribute of type <a href="link.to.uri">uri</a></p>
                                 </div>
                                 <p class="description">A namespace qualifying the property's name. This allows different organizations to
                                    associate distinct semantics with the same name.</p>
                                 
                                 --&gt;

                                 <details open="open" class="remarks-group">
                                    <summary>Remarks</summary>
                                    <div class="remarks">
                                       <p>Provides a means to segment the value space for the <code>name</code>, so that different organizations and individuals can assert control over the allowed
                                          names and associated values used in a property. This allows the semantics associated

                                       <p>An organization MUST use a URI that they have control over. e.g., a domain registered
                                          to the organization in a URI, a registered uniform resource names (URN) namespace.</p>
                                       <p>When a <code>ns</code> is not provided, its value should be assumed to be <code>http://csrc.nist.gov/ns/oscal</code> and the name should be a name defined by the associated OSCAL model.</p>

                                          that points to a <code>back-matter</code> <code>resource</code> in the same document.</p>
                                       <p>If a local reference using a fragment is used, this will be indicated by a fragment
                                          "#" followed by an identifier which references an identified <code>resource</code> in the document's <code>back-matter</code> or another object that is within the scope of the containing OSCAL document.</p>
                                       <p>If an internet resource is used, the <code>href</code> value will be an absolute or relative URI pointing to the location of the referenced
                                          resource. A relative URI will be resolved relative to the location of the document
                                          containing the link.</p>

                        </div>
                        <p>See <a href="../xml-outline/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject">/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject</a> in the element map.</p>
                        <div class="obj-desc">
                           <div class="obj-matrix">
                              <p class="obj-name">element Subject of Assessment</p>
                              <p class="occurrence"><span class="cardinality">[1 to ∞]</span></p>
                              <p>An element </p>
                           </div>
                           <p class="description">Identifies system elements being assessed, such as components, inventory items, and
                              locations. In the assessment plan, this identifies a planned assessment subject. In
                              the assessment results this is an actual assessment subject, and reflects any changes
                              from the plan. exactly what will be the focus of this assessment. Any subjects not

                                    through a subject-placeholder reference. Such a task will "consume" these subjects.</p>

                              <div class="remarks">

                                    matching entries in the exclude.</p>

                        <section class="xml-element">
                           <div class="header">
                              <div class="crosslink"><a href="../json-reference/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risks/characterizations/origin/related-tasks/identified-subject/subjects/props"><button class="schema-link">Switch to JSON</button></a></div>
                              <h8 id="/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/prop" class="toc8 head">prop</h8>
                           </div>
                           <p>See <a href="../xml-outline/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/prop">/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/prop</a> in the element map.</p>
                           <div class="obj-desc">
                              <div class="obj-matrix">
                                 <p class="obj-name">element Property</p>
                                 <p class="occurrence"><span class="cardinality">[0 to ∞]</span></p>
                                 <p>An element </p>
                              </div>
                              <p class="description">An attribute, characteristic, or quality of the containing object expressed as a namespace
                                 qualified name/value pair. The value of a property is a simple scalar value, which
                                 may be expressed as a list of values.</p>
                              
                              --&gt;      
                              
                              --&gt;      
                              <details open="open" class="remarks-group">
                                 <summary>Remarks</summary>
                                 <div class="remarks">
                                    <p>Properties permit the deployment and management of arbitrary controlled values, within
                                       OSCAL objects. A property can be included for any purpose useful to an application
                                       or implementation. Typically, properties will be used to sort, filter, select, order,
                                       and arrange OSCAL content objects, to relate OSCAL objects to one another, or to associate
                                       an OSCAL object to class hierarchies, taxonomies, or external authorities. Thus, the
                                       lexical composition of properties may be constrained by external processes to ensure
                                       consistency.</p>
                                    <p>Property allows for associated remarks that describe why the specific property value
                                       was applied to the containing object, or the significance of the value in the context
                                       of the containing object.</p>
                                 </div>
                              </details>
                           </div>
                           <section class="xml-element">

                              </div>
                              <p>See <a href="../xml-outline/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/prop/@name">/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/prop/@name</a> in the element map.</p>

                                    quality of the property's containing object.</p>
                                 
                                 --&gt;

                                 --&gt;      </div>
                           </section>

                           <section class="xml-element">
                              <div class="header">
                                 <div class="crosslink"><a href="../json-reference/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risks/characterizations/origin/related-tasks/identified-subject/subjects/props/ns"><button class="schema-link">Switch to JSON</button></a></div>
                                 <h9 id="/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/prop/@ns" class="toc9 head">@ns</h9>
                              </div>
                              <p>See <a href="../xml-outline/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/prop/@ns">/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/prop/@ns</a> in the element map.</p>
                              <div class="obj-desc">
                                 <div class="obj-matrix">
                                    <p class="obj-name">attribute Property Namespace</p>
                                    <p class="occurrence"><span class="cardinality">[0 or 1]</span></p>
                                    <p>An attribute of type <a href="link.to.uri">uri</a></p>
                                 </div>
                                 <p class="description">A namespace qualifying the property's name. This allows different organizations to
                                    associate distinct semantics with the same name.</p>
                                 
                                 --&gt;      
                                 
                                 --&gt;      
                                 <details open="open" class="remarks-group">
                                    <summary>Remarks</summary>
                                    <div class="remarks">
                                       <p>Provides a means to segment the value space for the <code>name</code>, so that different organizations and individuals can assert control over the allowed
                                          names and associated values used in a property. This allows the semantics associated
                                          with a given name/value pair to be defined on an organization-by-organization basis.</p>
                                       <p>An organization MUST use a URI that they have control over. e.g., a domain registered
                                          to the organization in a URI, a registered uniform resource names (URN) namespace.</p>
                                       <p>When a <code>ns</code> is not provided, its value should be assumed to be <code>http://csrc.nist.gov/ns/oscal</code> and the name should be a name defined by the associated OSCAL model.</p>
                                    </div>
                                 </details>
                              </div>
                           </section>
                           <section class="xml-element">
                              <div class="header">
                                 <div class="crosslink"><a href="../json-reference/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risks/characterizations/origin/related-tasks/identified-subject/subjects/props/value"><button class="schema-link">Switch to JSON</button></a></div>

                              </div>

                                 <h9 id="/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/prop/@class" class="toc9 head">@class</h9>
                              </div>
                              <p>See <a href="../xml-outline/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/prop/@class">/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/prop/@class</a> in the element map.</p>
                              <div class="obj-desc">

                                 </div>
                                 <p class="description">A textual label that provides a sub-type or characterization of the property's <code>name</code>. This can be used to further distinguish or discriminate between the semantics of
                                    multiple properties of the same object with the same <code>name</code> and <code>ns</code>. </p>
                                 
                                 --&gt;      
                                 
                                 --&gt;      
                                 <details open="open" class="remarks-group">
                                    <summary>Remarks</summary>
                                    <div class="remarks">
                                       <p>A <code>class</code> can be used in validation rules to express extra constraints over named items of
                                          a specific <code>class</code> value.</p>
                                    </div>
                                 </details>
                              </div>
                           </section>

                              <div class="obj-desc">
                                 <div class="obj-matrix">
                                    <p class="obj-name">element Remarks</p>
                                    <p class="occurrence"><span class="cardinality">[0 or 1]</span></p>

                        <section class="xml-element">
                           <div class="header">
                              <div class="crosslink"><a href="../json-reference/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risks/characterizations/origin/related-tasks/identified-subject/subjects/links"><button class="schema-link">Switch to JSON</button></a></div>
                              <h8 id="/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/link" class="toc8 head">link</h8>
                           </div>
                           <p>See <a href="../xml-outline/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/link">/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/link</a> in the element map.</p>
                           <div class="obj-desc">
                              <div class="obj-matrix">
                                 <p class="obj-name">element Link</p>
                                 <p class="occurrence"><span class="cardinality">[0 to ∞]</span></p>
                                 <p>An element </p>
                              </div>
                              <p class="description">A reference to a local or remote resource</p>
                              
                              --&gt;      
                              
                              --&gt;      
                              
                              --&gt;      
                              <details open="open" class="remarks-group">
                                 <summary>Remarks</summary>
                                 <div class="remarks">
                                    <p>To provide a cryptographic hash for a remote target resource, a local reference to
                                       a back matter <code>resource</code> is needed. The resource allows one or more hash values to be provided using the <code>rlink/hash</code> object.</p>
                                    <p>The OSCAL <code>link</code> is a roughly based on the HTML <a>link element</a>. </p>
                                 </div>
                              </details>
                           </div>
                           <section class="xml-element">
                              <div class="header">
                                 <div class="crosslink"><a href="../json-reference/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risks/characterizations/origin/related-tasks/identified-subject/subjects/links/href"><button class="schema-link">Switch to JSON</button></a></div>
                                 <h9 id="/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/link/@href" class="toc9 head">@href</h9>
                              </div>
                              <p>See <a href="../xml-outline/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/link/@href">/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/link/@href</a> in the element map.</p>
                              <div class="obj-desc">
                                 <div class="obj-matrix">
                                    <p class="obj-name">attribute Hypertext Reference</p>
                                    <p class="occurrence"><span class="cardinality">[1]</span></p>
                                    <p>An attribute of type <a href="link.to.uri-reference">uri-reference</a></p>
                                 </div>
                                 <p class="description">A resolvable URL reference to a resource.</p>
                                 
                                 --&gt;      
                                 
                                 --&gt;      
                                 
                                 --&gt;      
                                 <details open="open" class="remarks-group">
                                    <summary>Remarks</summary>
                                    <div class="remarks">
                                       <p>The value of the <code>href</code> can be an internet resource, or a local reference using a fragment e.g. #fragment
                                          that points to a <code>back-matter</code> <code>resource</code> in the same document.</p>
                                       <p>If a local reference using a fragment is used, this will be indicated by a fragment
                                          "#" followed by an identifier which references an identified <code>resource</code> in the document's <code>back-matter</code> or another object that is within the scope of the containing OSCAL document.</p>
                                       <p>If an internet resource is used, the <code>href</code> value will be an absolute or relative URI pointing to the location of the referenced
                                          resource. A relative URI will be resolved relative to the location of the document
                                          containing the link.</p>
                                    </div>
                                 </details>
                              </div>
                           </section>
                           <section class="xml-element">

                              </div>
                              <p>See <a href="../xml-outline/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/include-subject/@type">/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/include-subject/@type</a> in the element map.</p>

                           <section class="xml-element">
                              <div class="header">
                                 <div class="crosslink"><a href="../json-reference/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risks/characterizations/origin/related-tasks/identified-subject/subjects/include-subjects/props"><button class="schema-link">Switch to JSON</button></a></div>
                                 <h9 id="/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/include-subject/prop" class="toc9 head">prop</h9>
                              </div>
                              <p>See <a href="../xml-outline/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/include-subject/prop">/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/include-subject/prop</a> in the element map.</p>
                              <div class="obj-desc">
                                 <div class="obj-matrix">
                                    <p class="obj-name">element Property</p>
                                    <p class="occurrence"><span class="cardinality">[0 to ∞]</span></p>
                                    <p>An element </p>
                                 </div>
                                 <p class="description">An attribute, characteristic, or quality of the containing object expressed as a namespace
                                    qualified name/value pair. The value of a property is a simple scalar value, which
                                    may be expressed as a list of values.</p>
                                 
                                 --&gt;      
                                 
                                 --&gt;      
                                 <details open="open" class="remarks-group">
                                    <summary>Remarks</summary>
                                    <div class="remarks">
                                       <p>Properties permit the deployment and management of arbitrary controlled values, within
                                          OSCAL objects. A property can be included for any purpose useful to an application
                                          or implementation. Typically, properties will be used to sort, filter, select, order,
                                          and arrange OSCAL content objects, to relate OSCAL objects to one another, or to associate
                                          an OSCAL object to class hierarchies, taxonomies, or external authorities. Thus, the
                                          lexical composition of properties may be constrained by external processes to ensure
                                          consistency.</p>
                                       <p>Property allows for associated remarks that describe why the specific property value
                                          was applied to the containing object, or the significance of the value in the context
                                          of the containing object.</p>
                                    </div>
                                 </details>
                              </div>
                              <section class="xml-element">
                                 <div class="header">
                                    <div class="crosslink"><a href="../json-reference/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risks/characterizations/origin/related-tasks/identified-subject/subjects/include-subjects/props/name"><button class="schema-link">Switch to JSON</button></a></div>
                                    <h10 id="/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/include-subject/prop/@name" class="toc10 head">@name</h10>
                                 </div>
                                 <p>See <a href="../xml-outline/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/include-subject/prop/@name">/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/include-subject/prop/@name</a> in the element map.</p>
                                 <div class="obj-desc">
                                    <div class="obj-matrix">
                                       <p class="obj-name">attribute Property Name</p>
                                       <p class="occurrence"><span class="cardinality">[1]</span></p>
                                       <p>An attribute of type <a href="link.to.NCName">NCName</a></p>
                                    </div>
                                    <p class="description">A textual label that uniquely identifies a specific attribute, characteristic, or
                                       quality of the property's containing object.</p>
                                    
                                    --&gt;      
                                    
                                    --&gt;      
                                    
                                    --&gt;      </div>
                              </section>
                              <section class="xml-element">
                                 <div class="header">
                                    <div class="crosslink"><a href="../json-reference/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risks/characterizations/origin/related-tasks/identified-subject/subjects/include-subjects/props/uuid"><button class="schema-link">Switch to JSON</button></a></div>
                                    <h10 id="/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/include-subject/prop/@uuid" class="toc10 head">@uuid</h10>
                                 </div>
                                 <p>See <a href="../xml-outline/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/include-subject/prop/@uuid">/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/include-subject/prop/@uuid</a> in the element map.</p>
                                 <div class="obj-desc">
                                    <div class="obj-matrix">
                                       <p class="obj-name">attribute Property Universally Unique Identifier</p>
                                       <p class="occurrence"><span class="cardinality">[0 or 1]</span></p>
                                       <p>An attribute of type <a href="link.to.uuid">uuid</a></p>
                                    </div>
                                    <p class="description">A unique identifier that can be used to reference this property elsewhere in an OSCAL
                                       document. A UUID should be consistently used for a given location across revisions
                                       of the document.</p>
                                    
                                    --&gt;      
                                    
                                    --&gt;      </div>
                              </section>
                              <section class="xml-element">
                                 <div class="header">
                                    <div class="crosslink"><a href="../json-reference/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risks/characterizations/origin/related-tasks/identified-subject/subjects/include-subjects/props/ns"><button class="schema-link">Switch to JSON</button></a></div>
                                    <h10 id="/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/include-subject/prop/@ns" class="toc10 head">@ns</h10>
                                 </div>
                                 <p>See <a href="../xml-outline/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/include-subject/prop/@ns">/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/include-subject/prop/@ns</a> in the element map.</p>
                                 <div class="obj-desc">
                                    <div class="obj-matrix">
                                       <p class="obj-name">attribute Property Namespace</p>
                                       <p class="occurrence"><span class="cardinality">[0 or 1]</span></p>
                                       <p>An attribute of type <a href="link.to.uri">uri</a></p>
                                    </div>
                                    <p class="description">A namespace qualifying the property's name. This allows different organizations to
                                       associate distinct semantics with the same name.</p>
                                    
                                    --&gt;      
                                    
                                    --&gt;      
                                    <details open="open" class="remarks-group">
                                       <summary>Remarks</summary>
                                       <div class="remarks">
                                          <p>Provides a means to segment the value space for the <code>name</code>, so that different organizations and individuals can assert control over the allowed
                                             names and associated values used in a property. This allows the semantics associated
                                             with a given name/value pair to be defined on an organization-by-organization basis.</p>
                                          <p>An organization MUST use a URI that they have control over. e.g., a domain registered
                                             to the organization in a URI, a registered uniform resource names (URN) namespace.</p>
                                          <p>When a <code>ns</code> is not provided, its value should be assumed to be <code>http://csrc.nist.gov/ns/oscal</code> and the name should be a name defined by the associated OSCAL model.</p>
                                       </div>
                                    </details>
                                 </div>
                              </section>
                              <section class="xml-element">
                                 <div class="header">
                                    <div class="crosslink"><a href="../json-reference/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risks/characterizations/origin/related-tasks/identified-subject/subjects/include-subjects/props/value"><button class="schema-link">Switch to JSON</button></a></div>
                                    <h10 id="/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/include-subject/prop/@value" class="toc10 head">@value</h10>
                                 </div>
                                 <p>See <a href="../xml-outline/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/include-subject/prop/@value">/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/include-subject/prop/@value</a> in the element map.</p>
                                 <div class="obj-desc">
                                    <div class="obj-matrix">
                                       <p class="obj-name">attribute Property Value</p>
                                       <p class="occurrence"><span class="cardinality">[1]</span></p>
                                       <p>An attribute of type <a href="link.to.string">string</a></p>
                                    </div>
                                    <p class="description">Indicates the value of the attribute, characteristic, or quality.</p>
                                    
                                    --&gt;      
                                    
                                    --&gt;      </div>
                              </section>
                              <section class="xml-element">
                                 <div class="header">
                                    <div class="crosslink"><a href="../json-reference/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risks/characterizations/origin/related-tasks/identified-subject/subjects/include-subjects/props/class"><button class="schema-link">Switch to JSON</button></a></div>
                                    <h10 id="/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/include-subject/prop/@class" class="toc10 head">@class</h10>
                                 </div>
                                 <p>See <a href="../xml-outline/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/include-subject/prop/@class">/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/include-subject/prop/@class</a> in the element map.</p>
                                 <div class="obj-desc">
                                    <div class="obj-matrix">
                                       <p class="obj-name">attribute Property Class</p>
                                       <p class="occurrence"><span class="cardinality">[0 or 1]</span></p>
                                       <p>An attribute of type <a href="link.to.NCName">NCName</a></p>
                                    </div>
                                    <p class="description">A textual label that provides a sub-type or characterization of the property's <code>name</code>. This can be used to further distinguish or discriminate between the semantics of
                                       multiple properties of the same object with the same <code>name</code> and <code>ns</code>. </p>
                                    
                                    --&gt;      
                                    
                                    --&gt;      
                                    <details open="open" class="remarks-group">
                                       <summary>Remarks</summary>
                                       <div class="remarks">
                                          <p>A <code>class</code> can be used in validation rules to express extra constraints over named items of
                                             a specific <code>class</code> value.</p>
                                       </div>
                                    </details>
                                 </div>
                              </section>
                              <section class="xml-element">
                                 <div class="header">
                                    <div class="crosslink"><a href="../json-reference/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risks/characterizations/origin/related-tasks/identified-subject/subjects/include-subjects/props/remarks"><button class="schema-link">Switch to JSON</button></a></div>
                                    <h10 id="/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/include-subject/prop/remarks" class="toc10 head">remarks</h10>
                                 </div>
                                 <p>See <a href="../xml-outline/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/include-subject/prop/remarks">/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/include-subject/prop/remarks</a> in the element map.</p>
                                 <div class="obj-desc">
                                    <div class="obj-matrix">
                                       <p class="obj-name">element Remarks</p>
                                       <p class="occurrence"><span class="cardinality">[0 or 1]</span></p>
                                       <p>An element of type <a href="link.to.markup-multiline">markup-multiline</a></p>
                                    </div>
                                    <p class="description">Additional commentary on the containing object.</p>
                                    <div class="value" id="">
                                       <p>Value: A markup-multiline </p>
                                    </div>
                                    
                                    --&gt;      
                                    
                                    --&gt;      </div>
                              </section>
                           </section>
                           <section class="xml-element">
                              <div class="header">
                                 <div class="crosslink"><a href="../json-reference/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risks/characterizations/origin/related-tasks/identified-subject/subjects/include-subjects/links"><button class="schema-link">Switch to JSON</button></a></div>
                                 <h9 id="/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/include-subject/link" class="toc9 head">link</h9>
                              </div>
                              <p>See <a href="../xml-outline/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/include-subject/link">/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/include-subject/link</a> in the element map.</p>
                              <div class="obj-desc">
                                 <div class="obj-matrix">
                                    <p class="obj-name">element Link</p>
                                    <p class="occurrence"><span class="cardinality">[0 to ∞]</span></p>
                                    <p>An element </p>
                                 </div>
                                 <p class="description">A reference to a local or remote resource</p>
                                 
                                 --&gt;      
                                 
                                 --&gt;      
                                 
                                 --&gt;      
                                 <details open="open" class="remarks-group">
                                    <summary>Remarks</summary>
                                    <div class="remarks">
                                       <p>To provide a cryptographic hash for a remote target resource, a local reference to
                                          a back matter <code>resource</code> is needed. The resource allows one or more hash values to be provided using the <code>rlink/hash</code> object.</p>
                                       <p>The OSCAL <code>link</code> is a roughly based on the HTML <a>link element</a>. </p>
                                    </div>
                                 </details>
                              </div>
                              <section class="xml-element">
                                 <div class="header">
                                    <div class="crosslink"><a href="../json-reference/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risks/characterizations/origin/related-tasks/identified-subject/subjects/include-subjects/links/href"><button class="schema-link">Switch to JSON</button></a></div>
                                    <h10 id="/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/include-subject/link/@href" class="toc10 head">@href</h10>
                                 </div>
                                 <p>See <a href="../xml-outline/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/include-subject/link/@href">/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/include-subject/link/@href</a> in the element map.</p>
                                 <div class="obj-desc">
                                    <div class="obj-matrix">
                                       <p class="obj-name">attribute Hypertext Reference</p>
                                       <p class="occurrence"><span class="cardinality">[1]</span></p>
                                       <p>An attribute of type <a href="link.to.uri-reference">uri-reference</a></p>
                                    </div>
                                    <p class="description">A resolvable URL reference to a resource.</p>
                                    
                                    --&gt;      
                                    
                                    --&gt;      
                                    
                                    --&gt;      
                                    <details open="open" class="remarks-group">
                                       <summary>Remarks</summary>
                                       <div class="remarks">
                                          <p>The value of the <code>href</code> can be an internet resource, or a local reference using a fragment e.g. #fragment
                                             that points to a <code>back-matter</code> <code>resource</code> in the same document.</p>
                                          <p>If a local reference using a fragment is used, this will be indicated by a fragment
                                             "#" followed by an identifier which references an identified <code>resource</code> in the document's <code>back-matter</code> or another object that is within the scope of the containing OSCAL document.</p>
                                          <p>If an internet resource is used, the <code>href</code> value will be an absolute or relative URI pointing to the location of the referenced
                                             resource. A relative URI will be resolved relative to the location of the document
                                             containing the link.</p>
                                       </div>
                                    </details>
                                 </div>
                              </section>
                              <section class="xml-element">
                                 <div class="header">
                                    <div class="crosslink"><a href="../json-reference/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risks/characterizations/origin/related-tasks/identified-subject/subjects/include-subjects/links/rel"><button class="schema-link">Switch to JSON</button></a></div>
                                    <h10 id="/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/include-subject/link/@rel" class="toc10 head">@rel</h10>
                                 </div>
                                 <p>See <a href="../xml-outline/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/include-subject/link/@rel">/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/include-subject/link/@rel</a> in the element map.</p>
                                 <div class="obj-desc">
                                    <div class="obj-matrix">
                                       <p class="obj-name">attribute Relation</p>
                                       <p class="occurrence"><span class="cardinality">[0 or 1]</span></p>
                                       <p>An attribute of type <a href="link.to.NCName">NCName</a></p>
                                    </div>
                                    <p class="description">Describes the type of relationship provided by the link. This can be an indicator
                                       of the link's purpose.</p>
                                    
                                    --&gt;      
                                    
                                    --&gt;      
                                    
                                    --&gt;      
                                    
                                    --&gt;      </div>
                              </section>
                              <section class="xml-element">

                              </div>
                              <p>See <a href="../xml-outline/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/exclude-subject/@type">/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/exclude-subject/@type</a> in the element map.</p>

                           <section class="xml-element">
                              <div class="header">
                                 <div class="crosslink"><a href="../json-reference/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risks/characterizations/origin/related-tasks/identified-subject/subjects/exclude-subjects/props"><button class="schema-link">Switch to JSON</button></a></div>
                                 <h9 id="/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/exclude-subject/prop" class="toc9 head">prop</h9>
                              </div>
                              <p>See <a href="../xml-outline/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/exclude-subject/prop">/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/exclude-subject/prop</a> in the element map.</p>
                              <div class="obj-desc">
                                 <div class="obj-matrix">
                                    <p class="obj-name">element Property</p>
                                    <p class="occurrence"><span class="cardinality">[0 to ∞]</span></p>
                                    <p>An element </p>
                                 </div>
                                 <p class="description">An attribute, characteristic, or quality of the containing object expressed as a namespace
                                    qualified name/value pair. The value of a property is a simple scalar value, which
                                    may be expressed as a list of values.</p>
                                 
                                 --&gt;      
                                 
                                 --&gt;      
                                 <details open="open" class="remarks-group">
                                    <summary>Remarks</summary>
                                    <div class="remarks">
                                       <p>Properties permit the deployment and management of arbitrary controlled values, within
                                          OSCAL objects. A property can be included for any purpose useful to an application
                                          or implementation. Typically, properties will be used to sort, filter, select, order,
                                          and arrange OSCAL content objects, to relate OSCAL objects to one another, or to associate
                                          an OSCAL object to class hierarchies, taxonomies, or external authorities. Thus, the
                                          lexical composition of properties may be constrained by external processes to ensure
                                          consistency.</p>
                                       <p>Property allows for associated remarks that describe why the specific property value
                                          was applied to the containing object, or the significance of the value in the context
                                          of the containing object.</p>
                                    </div>
                                 </details>
                              </div>
                              <section class="xml-element">
                                 <div class="header">
                                    <div class="crosslink"><a href="../json-reference/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risks/characterizations/origin/related-tasks/identified-subject/subjects/exclude-subjects/props/name"><button class="schema-link">Switch to JSON</button></a></div>
                                    <h10 id="/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/exclude-subject/prop/@name" class="toc10 head">@name</h10>
                                 </div>
                                 <p>See <a href="../xml-outline/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/exclude-subject/prop/@name">/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/exclude-subject/prop/@name</a> in the element map.</p>
                                 <div class="obj-desc">
                                    <div class="obj-matrix">
                                       <p class="obj-name">attribute Property Name</p>
                                       <p class="occurrence"><span class="cardinality">[1]</span></p>
                                       <p>An attribute of type <a href="link.to.NCName">NCName</a></p>
                                    </div>
                                    <p class="description">A textual label that uniquely identifies a specific attribute, characteristic, or
                                       quality of the property's containing object.</p>
                                    
                                    --&gt;      
                                    
                                    --&gt;      
                                    
                                    --&gt;      </div>
                              </section>
                              <section class="xml-element">
                                 <div class="header">
                                    <div class="crosslink"><a href="../json-reference/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risks/characterizations/origin/related-tasks/identified-subject/subjects/exclude-subjects/props/uuid"><button class="schema-link">Switch to JSON</button></a></div>
                                    <h10 id="/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/exclude-subject/prop/@uuid" class="toc10 head">@uuid</h10>
                                 </div>
                                 <p>See <a href="../xml-outline/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/exclude-subject/prop/@uuid">/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/exclude-subject/prop/@uuid</a> in the element map.</p>
                                 <div class="obj-desc">
                                    <div class="obj-matrix">
                                       <p class="obj-name">attribute Property Universally Unique Identifier</p>
                                       <p class="occurrence"><span class="cardinality">[0 or 1]</span></p>
                                       <p>An attribute of type <a href="link.to.uuid">uuid</a></p>
                                    </div>
                                    <p class="description">A unique identifier that can be used to reference this property elsewhere in an OSCAL
                                       document. A UUID should be consistently used for a given location across revisions
                                       of the document.</p>
                                    
                                    --&gt;      
                                    
                                    --&gt;      </div>
                              </section>
                              <section class="xml-element">
                                 <div class="header">
                                    <div class="crosslink"><a href="../json-reference/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risks/characterizations/origin/related-tasks/identified-subject/subjects/exclude-subjects/props/ns"><button class="schema-link">Switch to JSON</button></a></div>
                                    <h10 id="/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/exclude-subject/prop/@ns" class="toc10 head">@ns</h10>
                                 </div>
                                 <p>See <a href="../xml-outline/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/exclude-subject/prop/@ns">/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/exclude-subject/prop/@ns</a> in the element map.</p>
                                 <div class="obj-desc">
                                    <div class="obj-matrix">
                                       <p class="obj-name">attribute Property Namespace</p>
                                       <p class="occurrence"><span class="cardinality">[0 or 1]</span></p>
                                       <p>An attribute of type <a href="link.to.uri">uri</a></p>
                                    </div>
                                    <p class="description">A namespace qualifying the property's name. This allows different organizations to
                                       associate distinct semantics with the same name.</p>
                                    
                                    --&gt;      
                                    
                                    --&gt;      
                                    <details open="open" class="remarks-group">
                                       <summary>Remarks</summary>
                                       <div class="remarks">
                                          <p>Provides a means to segment the value space for the <code>name</code>, so that different organizations and individuals can assert control over the allowed
                                             names and associated values used in a property. This allows the semantics associated
                                             with a given name/value pair to be defined on an organization-by-organization basis.</p>
                                          <p>An organization MUST use a URI that they have control over. e.g., a domain registered
                                             to the organization in a URI, a registered uniform resource names (URN) namespace.</p>
                                          <p>When a <code>ns</code> is not provided, its value should be assumed to be <code>http://csrc.nist.gov/ns/oscal</code> and the name should be a name defined by the associated OSCAL model.</p>
                                       </div>
                                    </details>
                                 </div>
                              </section>
                              <section class="xml-element">
                                 <div class="header">
                                    <div class="crosslink"><a href="../json-reference/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risks/characterizations/origin/related-tasks/identified-subject/subjects/exclude-subjects/props/value"><button class="schema-link">Switch to JSON</button></a></div>
                                    <h10 id="/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/exclude-subject/prop/@value" class="toc10 head">@value</h10>
                                 </div>
                                 <p>See <a href="../xml-outline/#/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/exclude-subject/prop/@value">/plan-of-action-and-milestones/risk/characterization/origin/related-task/identified-subject/subject/exclude-subject/prop/@value</a> in the element map.</p>
                                 <div class="obj-desc">
                                    <div class="obj-matrix">
